At the same time, it's an out-and-out entertainer."

column2: India's 40th scientific expedition to Antarctica to leave from Goa on Jan 5
column3: India's 40th scientific expedition to Antarctica will leave on a ship from Goa on January 5 with 43 members, less than the conventional strength, due to COVID-19. The vessel will sail from Goa's MPT to Cape Town, from where it will reach Antarctica in about 18 days. Two helicopters will be added to the expedition at Cape Town.

column2: Never-before-seen particle found in blood of septic patients: Study
column3: La Jolla Institute for Immunology researchers have discovered that people with sepsis have "never-before-seen" particles called 'ENDS' in their blood. They showed that these particles break off of immune cells and change their shape as they course through the body. Compared with healthy subjects, the researchers showed that ENDS are around 100-fold more detectable in septic patients.

column2: Never thought I would again see India get dismissed for 42 or less: Viswanath
column3: Gundappa Viswanath, who was in the Indian team that got dismissed for 42 against England at Lord's in 1974, said he never thought he would see India getting all out for 42 or less again in his lifetime. "They have to just leave this behind...The Indian team have played enough cricket to get this out of their system," said Viswanath.

column2: Some rebel fighters in Tigray region not yet defeated: Ethiopia
column3: Ethiopia on Tuesday said there were some rebel fighters in Tigray who had not been defeated yet. Last month, Ethiopian PM had declared the operation against the rebels complete. Separately, Ethiopia said a UN team visiting the region was shot at by soldiers after they tried to pass through a checkpoint without stopping while driving to an unauthorised area.

column2: Happy old man looking ahead at bright future: Greta as Trump leaves White House
column3: Environmentalist Greta Thunberg tweeted the photo of Donald Trump exiting the White House as the US President for the last time and wrote, "He seems like a very happy old man looking forward to a bright and wonderful future. So nice to see!" Trump called Thunberg a "happy young girl" after her speech at the 2019 UN Climate Action Summit.

column2: Evidence of 'lost' river that ran through Thar Desert 1,72,000 years ago found
column3: Researchers have found evidence of a 'lost' river that ran through the central Thar Desert, near Bikaner, as early as 1,72,000 years ago. The findings published in the journal Quaternary Science Reviews represent the oldest directly dated phase of river activity at Nal Quarry in the central Thar Desert. The river would've offered a lifeline to Paleolithic populations, researchers said.

column2: Australians are bad losers, bio-bubble controversy a big gimmick: Pragyan Ojha
column3: Reacting to five India cricketers being placed in isolation over potential 'bio-bubble' breach, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said, "Everybody knows Australians are bad losers. They couldn't take MCG defeat." "It's a big gimmick to take pressure off Australia and try to get under the skin of Indians...They don’t know we exactly know what they are trying to do," he added.

column2: Remdesivir becomes first drug to be fully approved for COVID-19 by US
column3: The US Food and Drug Administration on Thursday approved Gilead's antiviral drug remdesivir for treating patients hospitalised with COVID-19, making it the first and only drug approved for the disease in the US. Remdesivir was given to President Donald Trump this month when he was diagnosed with COVID-19. It was originally developed as a treatment for Ebola and Hepatitis C.

column2: Fans troll pitch being used in NZ-WI Test match after pics go viral
column3: Several pictures of the green-top pitch being used for the first New Zealand-West Indies Test in Hamilton have gone viral on social media. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "Looks like the groundsmen forgot to make the pitch." Meanwhile, other tweets read, "I wish my lawn looked like that pitch" and "That might be the greenest pitch I've ever seen."

column2: Apple files patent for light-absorbent Matte Black finish for devices
column3: Apple has filed a patent in the US that suggests it's working on a Matte Black finish that can be deployed across its devices such as iPhones and Macs among others. The finish will include randomly distributed light-absorbing features, according to the patent. The finish can be used on metals including aluminium and titanium, which are part of Apple devices.

column2: Alibaba's m-cap falls by $60 bn after Ant Group's IPO suspension
column3: Ant Group's IPO being held up in Shanghai and Hong Kong has caused a sell-off of Alibaba shares. Sister-company Alibaba's shares fell around 8% which resulted in a cut of $60 billion in market capitalisation in one day as reports of Ant's regulatory issues with China emerged. Ant Group spun out of Alibaba, which owns 33% in the fintech major.

column2: Jeff Bezos names Blue Origin's landing ship after his mother
column3: Jeff Bezos on Wednesday unveiled Blue Origin's latest landing ship and revealed that it has been named after his mother, Jacklyn Bezos. "New Glenn's first stage will come home to the Jacklyn after every flight," he wrote in an Instagram post. The 600-foot ship has been designed as a floating landing point for the first-stage booster of New Glenn rocket.

column2: Parthiv Patel retires from all forms of cricket at 35 after 18-yr career, shares note
column3: Wicketkeeper-batsman Parthiv Patel has announced his retirement from all forms of cricket aged 35, ending his 18-year-long playing career. Sharing a farewell note on social media, Parthiv wrote, "I feel at peace having played the game in its truest tenets." Parthiv had made his international debut aged 17 and went on to represent India in 65 international matches.

column2: India's confidence would take a hit: Hussey on Shami's injury
column3: On Mohammad Shami being reportedly ruled out of the remaining Tests against Australia after suffering a fracture in his arm, former Australian cricketer Michael Hussey said that the unavailability of the pacer will be a "hammer blow" for India. "I think [Team India's] confidence would have really taken a hit and there'll be a few doubts in mind," Hussey added.

column2: Pandya gives away his Man of the Series trophy to Natarajan, says 'You deserve it'
column3: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya gave away his Man of the Series trophy to fast bowler T Natarajan after the T20I series against Australia concluded today. Pandya took to Instagram and wrote, "Natarajan, you were outstanding...To perform brilliantly in difficult conditions on your India debut speaks volumes of your talent and hardwork...You deserve Man of the Series from my side bhai!"

column2: My little boy has asked me to wake him up whenever Kohli comes to bat: Vaughan
column3: Talking about Team India captain Virat Kohli's impact on children, ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said, "My little boy...always asks me to wake him up when Kohli comes out to bat. As soon as Kohli gets out, he goes back inside to do something else." He further said, "Kohli is that powerful with the kids."

column2: Mahindra's Korean unit SsangYong defaults on $55 million loan
column3: Automaker Mahindra & Mahindra's South Korean unit SsangYong Motor Company has defaulted on loan repayment of about $55 million. Around $27.5 million was owed to Bank of America, $18.3 million to JP Morgan Chase and $9.1 million to BNP Paribas on December 14. Mahindra has been looking for a buyer for all or most of its 75% stake since June.

column2: F1 driver apologises for groping model-friend in car and sharing video online
column3: Russia's 21-year-old driver Nikita Mazepin, who'll race for Haas in Formula One next year, has apologised after sharing a video on Instagram of himself groping his model-friend in a car. "I'm sorry for the offence I've rightly caused and the embarrassment I've brought to Haas F1 Team," he wrote. Mazepin's model-friend defended him, saying, "Nothing in...video was serious at all."

column2: I wouldn't have gone down that route: Shastri on Gavaskar's remark on Virat-Anushka
column3: Reacting to Sunil Gavaskar's remark that Virat Kohli just practised on Anushka Sharma's bowling in lockdown, Ravi Shastri said he wouldn't have made such a comment. "I wouldn't have gone down that route," he added. Further, talking about Anushka saying she was being targeted, Shastri said, "If she felt hurt, she has every right to say what she wants to."

column2: Now I've to become friends with everyone: Sajid on working after Wajid's death
column3: Late music composer Wajid Khan's brother Sajid Khan, in an interview, spoke about working without his brother. "Before Wajid used to meet...and I always used to be inside. And now, I've to meet all...artists," he said. "All singers and artists, Wajid used to be friends with them. Now I've to become friends with everyone and work with them," Sajid added.

column2: Musk passes Gates as world's 2nd richest, gets $100bn richer in 2020
column3: Tesla CEO Elon Musk passed Bill Gates to become the world's second-richest person after his net worth soared $7.2 billion to $127.9 billion on Monday, according to Bloomberg. The 49-year-old has added $100.3 billion to his fortune this year. Gates, who has donated $27 billion to his foundation since 2006, has a net worth of $127.7 billion.

column2: U'khand CM apologises to Cong leader after state BJP chief calls her 'budhiya'
column3: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat has apologised to the Leader of Opposition in state Assembly after state BJP chief Bansidhar Bhagat called her "budhiya". A delegation of Congress leaders led by state party chief Pritam Singh met DGP Ashok Kumar and gave a letter demanding an FIR against Bhagat under appropriate sections for his remaks.

column2: Australians are bad losers, bio-bubble controversy a big gimmick: Pragyan Ojha
column3: Reacting to five India cricketers being placed in isolation over potential 'bio-bubble' breach, ex-India spinner Pragyan Ojha said, "Everybody knows Australians are bad losers. They couldn't take MCG defeat." "It's a big gimmick to take pressure off Australia and try to get under the skin of Indians...They don’t know we exactly know what they are trying to do," he added.

column2: Battery-operated bikes to be included in Delhi's EV policy: Report
column3: Delhi's EV policy is being revised to include a segment on battery-operated bicycles and tricycles, HT reported. The government has drafted a proposal to offer monetary incentives on their purchase. The proposed revision includes cycles both in the passenger and cargo categories. In case of individual buyers, purchase incentive will be 25% of the MRP with a cap of ₹5,000.

column2: Instagram temporarily removes 'Recent' tab from hashtag pages in US
column3: Instagram has temporarily removed the 'Recent' tab from hashtag pages in the US ahead of the upcoming elections. "We are doing this to reduce the real-time spread of potentially harmful content that could pop up around the election," Instagram wrote. The 'Recent' tab is shown to users along with the 'Top' tab when they search by tags.

column2: Free to join any party: Rajini Makkal Mandram as some members move to DMK
column3: Rajini Makkal Mandram (RMM) has announced that its members are free to join any other political party of their choice after tendering a resignation. The statement came after three district secretaries of the party joined Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) on Sunday. "They shouldn't forget they are always Rajinikanth fans even if they join other parties," RMM leader VM Sudhakar said.

column2: 35-year-old woman falls into volcanic vent in US, escapes with dislocated shoulder
column3: While skiing with her husband on Oregon's Mount Hood, 35-year-old Caroline Sundbaum fell into a snow-covered fumarole, which is a vent in the side of a volcano that emits steam and gases. A bystander who saw Sundbaum’s fall rushed to help rescue her, using a rope he was carrying to pull her out. She escaped with a dislocated shoulder.

column2: Not upset with the delay in the release of '83': Director Kabir
column3: '83' director Kabir Khan, on being asked if he's upset with the delay in the release of the film due to the coronavirus pandemic, said, "No." Adding that it's a "rare" and "once in a lifetime" story, Kabir said, "We were sure that for '83', every cinema hall will become...stadium...So, I don't want to rob myself and...audience of that experience."

column2: Need to worry about our preparation, no advantage for Aus in Brisbane: Lyon
column3: Spinner Nathan Lyon feels Australia won't have any advantage going into the fourth Test at the Gabba against India, who have been plagued with injuries. "To be honest, we've to worry about our preparation...We know how talented India are and how hungry they are to win this series," Lyon said. Australia haven't lost a Test at the Gabba since 1988.

column2: China's largest search engine Baidu considers making own EVs: Report
column3: China's largest search engine Baidu is considering making its own electric vehicles and has held talks with automakers about the possibility, Reuters reported. Baidu, which also has an autonomous driving unit, is considering contract manufacturing or creating a majority-owned venture with automakers. Baidu recently got the permit to conduct fully driverless road tests in Beijing.

column2: I am just a living body without you: Divya Bhatnagar's brother after her death
column3: TV actress Divya Bhatnagar's brother Dev took to Instagram to mourn her demise. Sharing a picture, he wrote, "I'm just a living body without you. Who will make up for your absence?" "I can't even type the goodbye words...How will I spend the rest of my life now?" he added. Divya, who had tested COVID-19 positive, was put on ventilator.

column2: After pandemic I have lost a bit of my swag: Sudhir Mishra
column3: Commenting on the coronavirus lockdown, filmmaker Sudhir Mishra said, "I see myself as much more frail after the pandemic...I've lost a bit of my swag." Speaking about his father, who passed away in April, Sudhir said, "When I saw myself terrified, holding my father in my arms... running towards an ICU, and...watching him die, that has done something."

column2: Bezos' Blue Origin launches & lands latest New Shepard rocket, capsule
column3: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos' aerospace company Blue Origin has successfully launched and landed its latest New Shepard rocket and crew capsule. The capsule reached a maximum altitude of 107 kilometres, while the rocket flew up to a height of 106 kilometres. The capsule features six seats and has speakers with a microphone and a push-to-talk button at each seat.

column2: I've moved to Hawaii, will use Zoom to work from an island: Oracle Co-founder
column3: Oracle's billionaire Co-founder Larry Ellison informed his employees through an email that he is moving to Hawaii. "I'll be using the power of Zoom to work from the island of Lanai," he said in the email. Ellison reportedly paid $300 million for 90,000 acres on Lanai in 2012, and it is estimated that he owns 98% of the island.

column2: Those getting Sputnik V vaccine shot should give up alcohol for 2 months: Official
column3: A health official, Anna Popova, in Russia has warned that anyone getting vaccinated against COVID-19 with Sputnik V vaccine should give up alcohol for almost two months. Popova said that people should stop drinking alcohol at least two weeks before getting the first of two injections and then they should continue to abstain for a further 42 days.

column2: Sushant issue has not faded, CBI is investigating: Bihar CM Nitish
column3: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has said that the death case of Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput has not faded away due to the state Assembly elections. He said, "The CBI is investigating the case. It is the CBI's duty, and everything is being done." He added, "CBI will probe the case, we are now busy in the elections."

column2: Jaguar Land Rover sales drop 24% in pandemic-hit 2020
column3: Tata Motors-owned Jaguar Land Rover sales dropped nearly 24% in the calendar year 2020 owing to the ongoing pandemic. However, the company said that it saw a 13.1% quarter-on-quarter increase in sales during the October-December period. JLR's sales in China grew 19.1% year-on-year while it slipped by 16.3% in Europe and 17.2% in North America in the quarter.

column2: 35.8% voter turnout recorded till 5 pm in GHMC polls: T'gana EC
column3: The Telangana State Election Commission has said that 35.8% of over 74 lakh voters voted till 5 pm in the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) polls on Tuesday. The commission further said that the voter turnout was expected to touch 40%. The COVID-19 positive electors had been asked to cast their votes between 5 pm and 6 pm.

column2: Tata Motors' 'tere mere pyaar...' tweet sparks Tesla tie-up rumours, firm denies
column3: After a tweet by Tata Motors Electric Mobility, a division of Tata Motors, on Friday sparked rumours of a tie-up with Tesla, the Indian automaker said it "categorically denies all rumours suggesting the same". "We have not taken any decision regarding a strategic partner for our PV business," it added. Shares of Tata Motors jumped nearly 7% after the tweet.

column2: India's highest meteorological centre opens in Leh at 3,500 m above sea level
column3: Union Minister Harsh Vardhan on Tuesday inaugurated India's highest meteorological centre established at 3,500 m above sea level in Leh by the India Meteorological Department (IMD). It will provide specialised weather forecasts for traffic movement on highways, agriculture and defence personnel. After Itanagar in Arunachal Pradesh, the Leh centre is the second MC located in the Himalayas.

column2: Car that can transform into a plane within 3 minutes completes test flight
column3: A car that can transform itself into a plane within three minutes flew 1,500 feet in the air over Slovakia as part of a test flight. The vehicle, AirCar, has been developed by Slovakian firm KleinVision which released the video of the test flight. The two-seat model weighs 1,100 kg and can carry an additional load of 200 kg/flight.

column2: Epic submits complaint against Apple, Google over Fortnite in UK
column3: Epic Games has submitted a complaint against Google and Apple over Fortnite's removal from their stores to the UK's antitrust tribunal. Apple has abused its "dominant position", Epic has alleged. "Epic is not seeking damages from Apple or Google in the UK...or the US, it is simply seeking fair access and competition that will benefit all consumers," Epic said.

column2: Ant Group's Shanghai listing oversubscribed 872 times
column3: Ant Group's $17.2 billion Shanghai listing was oversubscribed 872 times, drawing $2.83 trillion in bids from investors. Alibaba-backed Ant Group has decided to exercise 15% overallotment option, increasing number of shares on offer to 1.92 billion from the initial 1.67 billion. The institutional order books for the Hong Kong listing were closed one day ahead of schedule due to oversubscription.

column2: Warner becomes first-ever batsman to score 500+ runs in 6 different IPL seasons
column3: SRH captain David Warner has become the first-ever batsman to score 500-plus runs in six different IPL seasons. With his unbeaten knock of 85 runs off 58 deliveries against MI, Warner took his run tally this season to 529 runs. He had scored 692, 641, 848, 562 and 528 runs in 2019, 2017, 2016, 2015 and 2014 IPL seasons, respectively.

column2: Post-Brexit trade talks paused due to 'significant divergences'
column3: Post-Brexit trade talks between UK and European Union have been halted due to "significant divergences". British and EU negotiators said the conditions for a deal have not been met even after a week of negotiations in London. UK PM Boris Johnson and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will discuss the "state of play" on Saturday, they added.

column2: To have babies in our family after so long is such a blessing: Hema
column3: Hema Malini, whose daughter Ahana Deol gave birth to twin girls on Thursday, has said, "To have babies in our family after so long is such a blessing." "After my daughters...were born there was a...long gap when there were no babies around us," she added. "When [they]...got married...my husband Dharamji (Dharmendra) and I prayed to be grandparents," Hema said.

column2: Delhi startup builds tech to do COVID-19 serosurvey of 1 cr samples per week
column3: Delhi-based IT startup Thalamus Irwine claims to have developed an artificial intelligence and IoT-based solution that can complete a COVID-19 serosurvey of 1 crore samples in one week. It has also partnered with state-run ITI to host its data. Serosurveys can help track the geographic spread of the virus by analysing antibodies in blood samples.

column2: CPI(ML) condemns NIA raids on civil society activists
column3: The CPI(ML) Central Committee has condemned the NIA raids on civil society activists in Bengaluru, Jammu and Kashmir and Delhi. "By using the NIA to crackdown on human rights defenders, humanitarian groups, journalists, and citizens, the Modi regime is seeking to ensure that there are no witnesses to its crimes against the people of J&K," the committee alleged.

column2: Devi Annapurna idol stolen 100 yrs ago is being brought back from Canada: PM
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said that Indians would feel proud to know that an ancient idol of Devi Annapurna is being brought back from Canada to India. PM Modi, in his radio programme 'Mann Ki Baat', said, "Almost 100 years ago in 1913, this idol was stolen from a temple in Varanasi and smuggled out of the country."

column2: China's AutoX to test self-driving vehicles in 4 more Chinese cities
column3: China's autonomous vehicle startup AutoX, which is backed by Alibaba, said it's preparing for tests in Beijing, western Chongqing and two other cities and will soon test its technology with FCA's Pacifica minivan. CEO Jianxiong Xiao said AutoX will also soon start testing driverless vehicles in China. AutoX had earlier received a permit for driverless testing in California.

column2: Who was FC Kohli, 'father of Indian IT industry' who passed away at 96?
column3: Faqir Chand Kohli, the founding CEO of TCS who was called the 'father of Indian IT/software industry', was born and raised in Peshawar. He received a bachelor's in electrical engineering from Canada's Queen's University and a master's degree from MIT. In 1951, he joined Tata Electric Companies (now Tata Power) and in 1968, he was tasked with running TCS.

column2: Cricket is a gentleman's game, no place of racial abuse: BCCI VP Rajeev Shukla
column3: After Team India management lodged a complaint with match officials over Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj being racially abused by "drunk supporters" at Sydney Cricket Ground, BCCI Vice President Rajeev Shukla said that these kinds of things are "not accepted". "I think the Australian court should take cognisance of it and these kinds of incidents must be prevented," he added.

column2: Startup uses Tharoor's caricature in ad without consent; MP takes legal action
column3: Edtech startup Mastree used MP Shashi Tharoor's caricature without his consent for their advertisement with caption, "Gift your child Shashi Tharoor's confidence." Tharoor has sought a public apology and a legally binding commitment to 'cease and desist such practices'. "I was shocked...of their advertising using my name and caricature as if to imply I had endorsed their courses," Tharoor said.

column2: Rich nations failing to fund poor countries' climate fight: UN chief
column3: UN Secretary-General António Guterres said that rich countries are failing to provide financial assistance to poor nations to cope with the effects of climate change and reduce greenhouse gas emissions. He added that poor countries were supposed to receive $100 billion in financial assistance from public and private sources this year. "In 2020 this will not happen," Guterres further said.

column2: Fire breaks out at Fatima's house, actress thanks fire department for prompt response
column3: A fire broke out at actress Fatima Sana Shaikh's house in Mumbai. The actress took to Instagram Stories to thank the officials of fire department for their prompt response. Sharing a picture, Fatima wrote, "A small fire broke at my place...and in a panic state...I called the fire department...they were here in no time. And took care of the situation."

column2: Weirdest rumour about me was I'm getting married to Ashutosh Rana: Sandhya
column3: Actress Sandhya Mridul, while speaking about the weirdest rumour she has heard about herself, said, "I was very new and...was working with Ashutosh Rana and somebody spread a rumour about me getting married to him." She added, "I was like, what the hell is going on? Are you mad? I was like these people will say things out of anything."

column2: Tesla opens its largest EV super-charging station in US
column3: Tesla has opened its largest Supercharger station with 56 charging points. The charging network is located between the Bay Area and Los Angeles, two of Tesla's biggest markets in the world, as per Electrek. Tesla has also built solar canopies for providing shade to the charging electric vehicles while also helping power the Supercharger station.

column2: Pak court jails 3 for vandalising Gurdwara Nankana Sahib last year
column3: A court in Pakistan on Tuesday sentenced three people up to two years in prison for vandalising Gurdwara Nankana Sahib last year. Imran Chishti, the main culprit, was sentenced to two years in jail and fined PKR 10,000 (over ₹4,560), a court official said. The other two culprits were sentenced to six months in jail, the official added.

column2: Workers of Toyota unit near B'luru to continue strike over workload
column3: Factory workers at Toyota Kirloskar Private Limited's Bidadi unit, located near Bengaluru, announced that they will continue their ongoing strike over increased workload, among other concerns. They said that they don't get time to drink water or use the washroom. The unit has been in a lockout since November 10, after 41 workers were suspended for allegedly questioning the management.

column2: Tesla shares jump 4.9%, its market value crosses $800B for 1st time
column3: Shares of Tesla jumped 4.9% on January 8, taking its market capitalisation to more than $800 billion for the first time ever. This comes right after Tesla's market value crossed $774 billion, making it Wall Street's fifth most valuable company, just behind Alphabet and ahead of Facebook. Tesla CEO Elon Musk surpassed Jeff Bezos to become the world's richest person.

column2: Sisodia reaches Lucknow to debate on AAP vs BJP governance model
column3: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, on Tuesday, reached Lucknow for an open debate to speak for Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's model of governance against UP CM Yogi Adityanath's model. "BJP leaders have gotten perturbed ever since Arvind Kejriwal made an announcement that AAP is going to fight the upcoming Uttar Pradesh elections," Sisodia said.

column2: South Africa to buy 15 lakh vaccines from Serum Institute of India
column3: South Africa’s health ministry on Thursday said that the country would get 15 lakh COVID-19 vaccines from the Serum Institute of India (SII). The first batch of 10 lakh would be sent in January and the remainder the following month. This comes after the Indian government clarified that the export of COVID-19 vaccines has not been banned.

column2: Smith would've needed 15-inch spikes to do what people are accusing him of: Langer
column3: Australia head coach Justin Langer has defended Steve Smith over the crease-scuffing controversy, saying, "He would’ve needed 15-inch spikes to do what people are accusing him of doing and messing up Rishabh Pant’s guard." Langer added, "I literally cannot believe some of the rubbish I read about Smith. Absolute load of rubbish." "He does it probably most games," Langer stated.

column2: Before and after pics show collapse of world's 2nd largest radio telescope
column3: Space tech company Maxar has shared before and after satellite images of the world's second-largest single-dish radio telescope at the Arecibo Observatory in Puerto Rico which collapsed recently. It had suffered damages due to tropical winds in August following which one of the suspension cables snapped last month. A decision to dismantle the structure had been taken before it collapsed.

column2: Execution of journalist was based on law: Iranian Prez Rouhani
column3: Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Monday said that the execution of journalist Ruhollah Zam was based on law and that Iran's judiciary is independent. The comments come as many countries including France and the US condemned the execution of the journalist. Zam was executed on Saturday for his work online that helped inspire nationwide economic protests in 2017.

column2: Democrats gain control of US Senate after winning both seats in Georgia
column3: The Democratic Party has gained control of the US Senate after it won both seats in runoff elections in Georgia. With this victory, both Democrats and Republicans have 50 members each in the 100-seat Senate. However, VP-elect Kamala Harris, who would be sworn in on January 20, would cast any tie-breaking votes in the Senate, thus giving Democrats a majority.

column2: Need to go with five bowlers, captain Rahane should bat at No. 4: Gambhir
column3: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has advised Team India to play five specialist bowlers in the second Test against Australia and has asked captain Ajinkya Rahane to bat at number four in Virat Kohli's absence. "I won't want him to stay at number five because if he is the captain now, he has to lead from the front," Gambhir said.

column2: Labuschagne trolled after video of him shouting 'No run' on leaving ball goes viral
column3: Australia batsman Marnus Labuschagne has been trolled for shouting 'No run' after leaving his first delivery in the first Test against India bowled by Jasprit Bumrah. "Labuschagne shouting 'No run' after a leave is peak Marnus Labuschagne," a fan tweeted. "Shrieking 'No run' as you aggressively leave the ball way outside off is pure boss mode," wrote another.

column2: 2 female Supreme Court judges shot dead in Afghanistan
column3: Two female Supreme Court judges were shot dead by unidentified gunmen in Afghanistan's Kabul on Sunday. The attack happened as they were travelling to their office in a court vehicle, said Ahmad Fahim Qaweem, a court spokesman. They were among more than 200 female judges working for the country's top court, the spokesman further said.

column2: Videos of Geminids meteor shower surface online
column3: Videos of the Geminids meteor shower, recognised as the best annual meteor shower a stargazer can see, have surfaced online. According to NASA, the Geminids travel 78,000 mph (35 km/s). The parent of the Geminids is 3200 Phaethon, which is arguably considered to be either an asteroid or an extinct comet, NASA said.

column2: Barely had any struggle when I joined the TV industry: Urvashi Dholakia
column3: Actress Urvashi Dholakia has said she "barely had any struggle" when she joined the TV industry. The actress, who joined the industry at the age of six, added, "Times were different at that point in time...At that time, there was barely any struggle." Urvashi further said she always loved acting and never saw it as a struggle.

column2: I don't consider it an apology: AI expert on Pichai's statement on her exit
column3: Former Google AI researcher Timnit Gebru in an interview with BBC said that she doesn't consider CEO Sundar Pichai's statement on her exit an apology. "He didn't even apologise for the company's handling of it," Gebru said. The researcher has alleged that she was fired from the company over an academic paper that she had co-authored.

column2: PM of another country shouldn't discuss India's affairs: Rajnath on Trudeau
column3: When asked about Canadian PM Justin Trudeau's comments on the farmers' agitation, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said, "First, I would like to say that the PM of another country should stop talking about India's internal affairs." Singh added, "India doesn't require any outside interference... It's our internal matter. No country has the right to comment on our internal affairs."

column2: Aparshakti Khurana to star in suspense thriller film with Madhavan
column3: Aparshakti Khurana will star in a suspense thriller film, which will be directed by Kookie Gulati. He shared the news on Instagram and wrote, "Super thrilled to announce my first suspense thriller with Madhavan, Khushali Kumar, Darshan Kumaar, Bhushan Kumar @tseries.official to be directed by @kookievgulati." He also shared a picture wherein he can be seen posing with his co-actors.

column2: If Rohit Sharma is fit, he'll slot at top order: Gavaskar
column3: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said that Rohit Sharma should open Team India's innings once he's available. "Rohit is a better Test player than Mayank Agarwal and Prithvi Shaw. If he's fit then he'll straightaway slot at the top of the order," he stated. Before the start of the series, Rohit had stated he was ready to bat at any position.

column2: Don't need a man opposite Katrina in the superhero film: Director Ali
column3: Filmmaker Ali Abbas Zafar, who has collaborated with Katrina Kaif for a superhero film, has said there will be no male actor in the film. "I don't need...man opposite Katrina in this film. She herself is...hero as well," he said. Ali added the film will be mounted on a huge scale and Katrina won't have a romantic track in it.

column2: Rahul Roy should be fine in 6-7 months: Relative after actor gets discharged
column3: Actor Rahul Roy, who suffered a brain stroke in November while shooting for a film, has been discharged from Mumbai's Wockhardt Hospital. "It will take some time but he should be fine in 6-7 months," his brother-in-law Romeer Sen said. The 'Aashiqui' actor took to Instagram on Thursday and wrote, "I'm recovering...it's still a long journey for a full recovery."

column2: There won't be enough vaccines to prevent rise in cases for 3-6 months: WHO
column3: "We are not going to have sufficient vaccinations in place to prevent a surge in (coronavirus) cases for three to six months," WHO's Dr Mike Ryan said. He called on people to maintain social distancing and follow other measures to prevent spread of COVID-19. His statement comes as UK became the first country to approve Pfizer's vaccine for widespread use.

column2: Singer Joe Jonas to make acting debut with war drama 'Devotion'
column3: American singer Joe Jonas will make his acting debut with war movie 'Devotion'. Joe will reportedly share screen space with Jonathan Majors, Glen Powell, Thomas Sadoski and Christina Jackson. The film will narrate the true story of US Navy fighter pilots, Jesse Brown and Tom Hudner. 'Devotion' will be directed by JD Dillard, who previously helmed 'Sweetheart' and 'Sleight'.

column2: Jehan Daruvala creates history, becomes first Indian to win Formula 2 race
column3: Carlin driver Jehan Daruvala on Sunday created history when he became the first Indian to win a Formula 2 race during the Sakhir Grand Prix. The 22-year-old emerged on top after a long battle with Dan Ticktum, eventually winning by a 2.9-second margin. Further, Michael Schumacher's son Mick Schumacher won the Formula 2 championship with 215 points.

column2: 1st known case of COVID-19 in non-captive wild mink found in US
column3: The first known case of COVID-19 in a non-captive wild mink has been confirmed, according to an alert issued by the US Department of Agriculture. The wild mink tested positive around an infected mink farm in Utah. The strain of the virus in the wild mink is "indistinguishable" from that in infected mink on farms around the state.

column2: SBI's mobile banking app YONO suffers system outage
column3: SBI's mobile banking app YONO suffered a system outage on Thursday, following which the bank issued an official statement on Twitter. "Steps are being taken for the restoration of uninterrupted service," it said, asking users to switch to OnlineSBI or YONO Lite for their needs. Earlier today, RBI temporarily halted HDFC from issuing new credit cards citing repeated system outages.

column2: Vihari should bat at number four or five in Virat's absence: MSK Prasad
column3: Former chief selector MSK Prasad feels Hanuma Vihari should bat up the order in Virat Kohli's absence in the Melbourne Test, starting December 26. "I would prefer Vihari batting at No. 4 or 5 in the next few Tests...He is a gutsy boy and I have confidence that he will do well if given the challenge," said MSK Prasad.

column2: Bigg Boss 14's talent manager Pista Dhakad dies in road accident aged 24
column3: Pista Dhakad, who worked as a talent manager in Bigg Boss 14, has died in a road accident. A vanity van ran over Dhakad after the 24-year-old's bike slipped and she fell on the road, according to SpotboyE. Actress Yuvika Chaudhary took to Instagram and wrote, "Why u left us so early...still in a shock. Can't believe I'm writing this."

column2: Global coronavirus death toll exceeds 20 lakh mark
column3: The death toll from coronavirus across the world rose to over 20 lakh, according to Johns Hopkins University tracker. The US has reported the highest coronavirus deaths globally at over 3.9 lakh, followed by Brazil at 2,08,246 and India at 1,51,918, the tracker showed. COVID-19 has killed more people than malaria and tuberculosis combined in the past year.

column2: YouTube bans accounts live-streaming fake US election results
column3: Several YouTube accounts live-streamed fake US election results to thousands of viewers even before any of the polls closed, before the site took the clips down as spam. Multiple channels showed the presidential elections maps with fake results and some even ran advertisements. YouTube said it will "be vigilant with regards to election-related content in the lead-up and post-election period."

column2: His patience, perseverance was praiseworthy: Ajay Jadeja on Rohit's 52(98)
column3: Former India player Ajay Jadeja has said that Rohit Sharma took his game one level higher in India's second innings of the Sydney Test. Jadeja added that Rohit, who scored 52 runs off 98 balls, showed patience and perseverance which was praiseworthy. "You don't see that from Rohit Sharma because he generally destroys the opposition," he further said.

column2: Ranbir, Tripti to team up for 'Kabir Singh' maker's 'Animal': Reports
column3: According to reports, 'Animal' makers will cast 'Bulbbul' actress Tripti Dimri opposite Ranbir Kapoor in the film. Filmfare said quoting a source, "Sara Ali Khan had also auditioned for the movie but the makers were quite impressed with Tripti's work and audition tape." 'Animal' will be helmed by 'Kabir Singh' director Sandeep Reddy Vanga.

column2: India has practically achieved its pre-2020 climate action targets: Javadekar
column3: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said on Friday that India has practically achieved its pre-2020 climate action targets. "For the big countries, this is an answer from India, that though not responsible for climate change, we are taking responsible actions to mitigate the challenge," he said. "They must also commit to advance commitments of the Kyoto Protocol," Javadekar added.

column2: Champions League game suspended after players walk off over alleged racism
column3: The Champions League match between Paris Saint-Germain and Basaksehir was postponed on Tuesday after players left the field after Basaksehir assistant coach accused fourth match official of racial abuse. According to the television footage, the fourth official was allegedly heard telling the referee, "Go and give it (the red card) to the Black one...go verify, the Black one over there."

column2: Haryana MLA quits as livestock board chief in support of farmers
column3: Extending his support to the protesting farmers, Haryana MLA Sombir Sangwan resigned as the Chairman of the State Livestock Development Board. Sangwan is an Independent MLA supporting the BJP-JJP coalition government in the state. "Like the entire country, farmers from my constituency Dadri are also protesting against these (farm) laws," he said in a letter to CM Manohar Lal Khattar.

column2: Chinese soldier captured at Indian side of LAC in Ladakh
column3: The Indian Army has said that a Chinese army soldier was apprehended on the Indian side of LAC in Ladakh's South of Pangong Tso lake area. "The PLA soldier had transgressed across the LAC and was taken into custody by Indian troops," it added. The Army stated that the PLA soldier is being dealt with as per laid down procedures.

column2: Chinese firm's COVID-19 vaccine is 86% effective: UAE
column3: A COVID-19 vaccine developed by Chinese state-owned pharmaceutical company Sinopharm is 86% effective, the United Arab Emirates (UAE), citing an interim analysis of late-stage clinical trials, said on Wednesday. The analysis shows 100% effectiveness in preventing moderate and severe cases of the disease, it added. It also shows no serious safety concerns, the UAE further said.

column2: Tesla enters India, registers itself as a company in Bengaluru
column3: Tesla has marked its entry in India and registered itself as a company in Bengaluru. According to a Registrar of Companies filing, the new entity 'Tesla India Motors and Energy Private Limited' is classified as a subsidiary of a foreign company. Tesla has named Vaibhav Taneja, Venkatrangam Sreeram and David Jon Feinstein as the three directors at the new entity.

column2: Gal reveals her husband, children have cameos in 'Wonder Woman 1984'
column3: Actress Gal Gadot revealed that her husband, Jaron Varsano, and their children Alma (9), and Maya (3), have cameos in her upcoming film 'Wonder Woman 1984', along with director Patty Jenkins' husband and son. "This movie is more than just a movie for...me, for Patty. It completely changed my life," she said in an interview with Kevin McCarthy.

column2: Dadlani's heart bleeds for Rhea but he was silent when women accused Anu Malik: Sona
column3: Sona Mohapatra has criticised Vishal Dadlani for not speaking against #MeToo accused Anu Malik and questioned his sense of justice after Dadlani shared a tweet wherein he talked about Rhea Chakraborty's alleged media trial. Sona tweeted, "Dadlani's heart bleeds for Rhea...None of this justice bent came into play for Vishal when endless women called out his #IndianIdol colleague Anu Malik."

column2: Presidential transition complicating vaccine distribution: Gates
column3: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates on Sunday said the transition of presidential administrations "is complicating" the COVID-19 vaccine distribution process. He added that he was "pleased" with the Biden administration, since it is "willing to rely on actual experts and not attack those experts". "I think we'll get through this in a positive way," Gates said.

column2: A very sad group of people is trying to disenfranchise my supporters: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump has said that "a very sad group of people" is trying to disenfranchise millions of his supporters who voted for him. "We were getting ready for a big celebration. We were winning everything, and all of a sudden that was just called off," Trump further said alleging fraud in the vote count.

column2: Always been a Bangalore boy in the IPL: Virat ahead of match vs DC
column3: Ahead of RCB's match against DC on Monday to seal a spot in the playoffs, their Delhi-born captain Virat Kohli clarified that he will always be a 'Bangalore boy' in the IPL. "(I have) never sort of drifted towards Delhi," Virat said. RCB have lost their last three matches and are now locked at 14 points with DC.

column2: Soumitra was a true gentleman: Radhika on her 'Ahalya' co-star
column3: Mourning the demise of Soumitra Chatterjee, actress Radhika Apte recalled her experience of working with the late Bengali actor in the 2015 short film 'Ahalya' and called him a true gentleman. "I'm...grateful that I got an opportunity to work alongside Soumitra sir...to be able to witness his craft as an actor, makes me feel very fortunate," she added.

column2: Bayern Munich knocked out of German Cup by 2nd-division team
column3: Bayern Munich were eliminated from the second round of the German Cup for the first time in 20 years after losing to second-division team Holstein Kiel in a penalty shootout on Wednesday. Kiel won 6-5 in the shootout after the match finished at 2-2 in extra time. "I've never been knocked out so early," said Bayern forward Thomas Muller.

column2: Do elderly women in farmer protests look like Khalistanis?: SAD chief
column3: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) President Sukhbir Singh Badal on Thursday said that there are elderly women in the farmers' protests. He added, "Do they look like Khalistanis? It is a way of calling farmers of the country as anti-nationals." Badal further said, "Does BJP or anybody else have the right to declare anybody as anti-national?"

column2: Trump-nominated World Bank chief 'deeply appalled' by Capitol violence
column3: World Bank President David Malpass, a former adviser to President Donald Trump, told his staff he was "deeply appalled" by the storming of the Capitol by Trump supporters on Wednesday. Malpass was appointed in April 2019 after being nominated by Trump for a five-year term. He also assured his staff that the bank was working to ensure their security.

column2: TMC MP says he's not leaving party after meeting with WB CM's nephew Abhishek Banerjee
column3: TMC MP Prasun Banerjee said that he's not leaving the party and urged those with grievances to "sink differences and work unitedly to fight BJP" in Assembly polls. This came after he held meeting with TMC MP and CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee. Recently, disgruntled TMC MP Satabdi Roy also decided to stay in party after meeting with Abhishek.

column2: Corals from Aus' 'Coral IVF' trial survive bleaching, on track to reproduce
column3: Coral populations from Australia's first "Coral IVF" trial on the Great Barrier Reef in 2016 have survived bleaching events and are on track to reproduce next year. Scientists said the larvae restoration technique worked just as they predicted and large corals can grow from tiny microscopic larvae within few years. The technique was first used just off Heron Island.

column2: With farmers suffering and pandemic, won't celebrate birthday: Dharmendra
column3: Actor Dharmendra, who will turn 85 on December 8, said that he does not wish to celebrate his birthday this year as people are suffering. "This year has been quite sad with the farmers suffering and the ongoing pandemic, it doesn't make one feel happy," he said. Dharmendra also mentioned that he stopped enjoying birthdays after his mother passed away.

column2: Juhi Chawla prays for KKR during CSK's run chase, picture goes viral
column3: Bollywood actress and Kolkata Knight Riders' (KKR) co-owner Juhi Chawla was spotted praying at the Dubai stadium on Thursday night during the final over of Chennai Super Kings' run chase. Pictures of her praying have gone viral on social media. However, CSK beat KKR by six wickets after successfully chasing down the target of 173 runs.

column2: India to soon be manufacturing hub of space assets: PM Modi to space industry
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi in his interaction with the space sector's key industries, startups and academia expressed that India will soon become a manufacturing hub of space assets. He also assured participants that they will be co-passengers with ISRO in this age of space research. He added that private investment in the sector will lead to creation of hi-tech jobs.

column2: Israel to share data with Pfizer in return for COVID-19 vaccine doses
column3: According to a bilateral agreement, Israel will share the medical data gathered from its vaccination drive with Pfizer in return for coronavirus vaccine doses. The objective is to analyse epidemiological data to determine at what point herd immunity is achieved during the vaccination drive, the agreement said. Israeli Health Minister Yuli Edelstein has called it a "classical win-win" situation.

column2: Suhana recreates Ariana's look from new album for Halloween, shares pic
column3: Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan recreated Ariana Grande's look from her new album 'Positions' for Halloween and posted the picture on Instagram stories. She paired a crop top with a skirt and also wore a black hairband to copy the Grammy-winner's hairstyle. "Being Ariana every Halloween. Manifestation," she wrote in the caption.

column2: Crowd crossed the line, this must be dealt with an iron fist: Ashwin on racial abuse
column3: Reacting to a section of Sydney crowd racially abusing Team India players, off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin said the team had faced abuses in Sydney earlier too, but the crowd has crossed the line now. "It's definitely not acceptable in this day and age...This must definitely be dealt with an iron fist...We must make sure that it doesn't happen again," he added.

column2: Donald Trump still pursuing election litigation: White House
column3: White House Press Secretary Kayleigh McEnany on Tuesday said that US President Donald Trump is "still pursuing ongoing litigation" related to the November 3 presidential election. The comments came a day after the Electoral College formally confirmed Joe Biden's victory over Trump in the elections. McEnany described the Electoral College vote as just "one step in the constitutional process".

column2: Entertainment will be critical when cars drive themselves: Elon Musk
column3: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, while discussing in-car gaming in autonomous vehicles, tweeted, "Entertainment will be critical when cars drive themselves." Tesla recently released an update that featured three new in-car video games. Musk said an online multiplayer version of one of the games will be added and asked people what Tesla should do with in-car gaming in an autonomous world.

column2: Auto industry lost ₹2,300cr a day in lockdown: Parliamentary panel
column3: The automotive industry suffered ₹2,300 crore loss per day during the COVID-19 lockdown, according to a parliamentary panel report submitted to Rajya Sabha Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu. The sector witnessed an estimated job loss of about 3.45 lakh, the report said. All major original equipment manufacturers (OEM) cut down their production by 18-20% due to low demand, it added.

column2: Trump defends his speech before Capitol riot, calls it 'appropriate'
column3: US President Donald Trump defended his speech before last week's Capitol riot in which he urged his supporters to "march onto Capitol Hill". "They've analysed my speech and my words and my final paragraph, my final sentence, and everybody...thought it was totally appropriate," Trump said. He added that while "you have to always avoid violence," his supporters were furious.

column2: Feel for Virat, selectors missed a trick: Kaif on absence of sixth bowler
column3: Former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif said he understood captain Virat Kohli's situation after BCCI selectors missed a trick while selecting the ODI squad against Australia. "No amount of chopping or changing will give Virat Kohli the sixth bowling option...A pace bowling all-rounder who doesn't bowl, a long tail, no part-time bowler in top order or on the bench," tweeted Kaif.

column2: Apple invests $60 million to back entrepreneurs of colour
column3: Apple on Wednesday announced investments worth $60 million, for projects aimed at "challenging systemic racism" in the US. The iPhone maker will invest $35 million in two funds which will fund several companies with a focus on entrepreneurs of colour and minority-owned firms. Apple will also invest $25 million in an innovation hub for historically Black colleges and universities.

column2: Three snow leopards test positive for coronavirus
column3: Three snow leopards, two males and a female, have tested COVID-19 positive at Louisville Zoo, the zoo and US Department of Agriculture's Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service confirmed on Friday. The leopards, whose symptoms are mild and include wheezes and dry coughs, are expected to fully recover, zoo officials said. They were likely infected by an asymptomatic staff member.

column2: BJP President JP Nadda tests positive for coronavirus, goes into home-isolation
column3: BJP National President JP Nadda on Sunday announced that he has tested positive for coronavirus. "My health is fine, and I'm following all the guidelines of home-isolation on the advice of doctors. Whoever has come in contact with me in the last few days, I request them to isolate themselves and get themselves checked," he tweeted.

column2: Chinese spacecraft brings 1st lunar samples in over 40 years
column3: China's Chang'e-5 probe successfully landed in the northern Chinese region, bringing back the first lunar rocks and soil retrieved by any country in over 40 years. China is now the third country to have retrieved lunar samples. It will be sharing a portion of the lunar soil with other nations and organisations based on international cooperation conventions.

column2: Lala you're 100% right: Amir on Afridi's tweet after fight with 21-yr-old Afghan pacer
column3: After a video of him getting angry at Kandy Tuskers' 21-year-old Afghan pacer Naveen-ul-Haq following his fight with Mohammad Amir went viral, Galle Gladiators captain Shahid Afridi posted a tweet with an advice to the youngster. Afridi said that his advice to Naveen-ul-Haq is to not indulge in abusive talk. Amir reacting to the tweet, saying, "Lala you're 100% right."

column2: Bhaskaracharya found gravitational theory 500 yrs before Newton: Nepal PM
column3: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli told WION that Bhaskaracharya discovered the theory of gravitation about "500 years" before Issac Newton in 1150 AD. He added that Bhaskaracharya's book was published in 1210 AD. Oli said that even in his coursebook he was told that Newton found out the theory of gravitation.

column2: Chadwick's Black Panther character won't be recast for sequel: Marvel
column3: Chadwick Boseman's character T'Challa will not be recast in 'Black Panther' sequel post the Hollywood actor's death, Marvel Studios president Kevin Feige said. "His portrayal of T'Challa the Black Panther...transcends any iteration of the character in any other medium from Marvel's past, and it's for that reason that we won't recast the character," Kevin said during Disney's Investor Day event.

column2: Assam's BTC poll results show people's faith in PM's leadership: Nadda
column3: BJP President JP Nadda said that Assam's Bodoland Territorial Council (BTC) poll results show people's faith in leadership and policies of PM Narendra Modi. He also congratulated NDA partner UPPL, Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal and other state BJP leaders for "securing clear majority". While BJP has won nine seats, UPPL has won 12 seats in the polls.

column2: Kangana begins action training for film 'Dhaakad'; shares pics
column3: Kangana Ranaut took to social media to share a series of pictures from her action rehearsals for the upcoming film 'Dhaakad'. "Don't like to multitask, but in these times one needs to go back to the beginning. In those days I worked like a horse, so along with filming Thalaivi I started action rehearsals," she wrote in the caption.

column2: Latest Test rankings out after India's defeat, Kohli closes gap on 1st-placed Smith
column3: The ICC on Sunday released the latest rankings for Test batsmen following India's defeat against Australia in the first Test in Adelaide. Team India captain Virat Kohli has managed to fractionally close the gap on first-placed Steve Smith from 25 points to 13 points. Kohli gained two points, whereas Smith's 1 and 1* lost him 10 points in the table.

column2: Stokes shares pics of his 'folded middle finger' gesture as tribute to his late father
column3: England all-rounder Ben Stokes took to Instagram to share pictures of his 'folded middle finger' gesture to pay tribute to his father Ged, who died aged 65 due to brain cancer. "In different places now me and you Ged but knowing you’ll always have this smile on your face makes me smile every time I think of you," Ben wrote.

column2: Flipkart adds Marathi language on app after MNS-Amazon case
column3: E-commerce major Flipkart has incorporated Marathi, India's third most-widely spoken language on its app. This comes days after Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) workers allegedly vandalised warehouses belonging to Amazon in Mumbai and Pune over the party's demand for the global e-commerce giant to add Marathi on its app. Amazon later added it and moved to withdraw its case against MNS.

column2: Actor Varun Tej Konidela tests negative for coronavirus
column3: Telugu actor Varun Tej Konidela, who contracted coronavirus last week, has now tested negative for the virus. The actor took to social media on Thursday to share the news and wrote, "Never thought a report saying 'Negative' would bring in so much joy to me. Yes, I tested COVID Negative. Thank you very much for all the love and prayers."

column2: Never called farmers' protest politically motivated: Amit Shah
column3: Union Minister Amit Shah, who arrived in Hyderabad on Sunday for a roadshow, said, "I never called the farmers' protest politically motivated, neither am I calling it now." He added, "I would like to tell [the farmers] that the Central government is ready to discuss all their issues over a meeting called upon by the Agriculture Minister...on December 3."

column2: Facebook Pages will no longer show number of 'likes'
column3: Facebook on Wednesday announced that it'll be making some changes to Facebook Pages. The redesign will no longer feature the "like" button or display the total number of "likes" the Pages receive. Further, Pages will get their own News Feed, allowing them to participate in conversations as the public figure or the brand, follow trends and interact with their fans.

column2: Staff doesn't need to be vaccinated before returning to office: Facebook CEO
column3: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg told employees during an all-hands meeting that they will not be required to get vaccinated with the COVID-19 vaccine to return to the office. Facebook has pointed out that vast majority of its corporate staff have been working from home since the 2020-beginning. It expects the vaccines will be widely available before it opens US offices.

column2: Workers of Toyota unit near B'luru to continue strike over workload
column3: Factory workers at Toyota Kirloskar Private Limited's Bidadi unit, located near Bengaluru, announced that they will continue their ongoing strike over increased workload, among other concerns. They said that they don't get time to drink water or use the washroom. The unit has been in a lockout since November 10, after 41 workers were suspended for allegedly questioning the management.

column2: Jack Ma suspected to be missing for 2 months after criticising China govt
column3: Chinese billionaire and Alibaba Co-Founder Jack Ma has not made a public appearance in more than two months after he criticised President Xi Jinping-led government. Ma criticised the country's "pawnshop" financial regulators and state-owned banks in a speech in October. China recently launched an anti-monopoly investigation into Alibaba, after suspending Jack Ma-owned Ant Group's $35-billion IPO.

column2: Shocked that Aus weren't good enough to win Test series vs India: Ponting
column3: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said he was "quite shocked" that hosts Australia didn't manage to win the Test series against an inexperienced Indian side that was plagued with injuries. "The cold hard facts of it are pretty much that was the India A team that played this Test match and still won...It's probably not even (India's) second-picked team," Ponting added.

column2: Some will sit at family tables missing a familiar face: WHO chief in Xmas message
column3: In a message for Christmas, WHO chief Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said we mustn't squander the sacrifices made to protect us from coronavirus pandemic by people or their families "who, this holiday season, will sit at family tables missing a familiar face". "Millions of people are today making great, heart-wrenching sacrifices by staying apart to stay safe," he added.

column2: Dubai Crown Prince 'races' against ostriches on his cycle, shares video
column3: Dubai Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum shared a video on Instagram in which he is seen 'racing' against two ostriches on his cycle. A speeding ostrich overtakes Hamdan, crosses his path and moves to the other side of the road. "This morning another close call #2021," he wrote while sharing the video.

column2: UK's security agency helps NHS fight cyber crime related to COVID-19
column3: UK's security agency National Cyber Security Centre is stepping in to help state-run National Health Service (NHS) fight cyber attacks related to COVID-19. The agency's assessment of NHS uncovered 35 internet domains that could be exposed to malicious activity. It reported that 200 of the 723 incidents that required its intervention from September 2019-August 2020 were pandemic-related.

column2: Megalodon babies, who ate siblings in womb, were larger than adult man: Study
column3: Enormous megatooth sharks, or megalodons, that lived over three million years ago, gave birth to babies larger than most adult humans, a study led by a DePaul University paleobiologist said. Data suggested an embryonic Megalodon grew by feeding on unhatched eggs in the womb. The typical lifespan of the species was at least 88 years.

column2: Riverine wetlands in Pune increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds: Study
column3: Botanists Savita and Sanjaykumar Rahangdale have said that riverine wetlands within city limits of Pune have been found to be increasingly flourishing with invasive weeds, like hyacinth. "In the last decade...these invasive weeds have captured and expanded their area. This is mainly due to the rising pollution levels in...rivers," Sanjaykumar said. The duo conducted a nine year-long study.

column2: Quentin Tarantino to release novel version of 'Once Upon A Time...'
column3: Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino is turning his 2019 film 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood' into a novel under a new deal he signed with publisher HarperCollins for two books. The books will mark Tarantino's first work of fiction in print and the novel is set to be published in the summer of 2021.

column2: India's 40th scientific expedition to Antarctica to leave from Goa on Jan 5
column3: India's 40th scientific expedition to Antarctica will leave on a ship from Goa on January 5 with 43 members, less than the conventional strength, due to COVID-19. The vessel will sail from Goa's MPT to Cape Town, from where it will reach Antarctica in about 18 days. Two helicopters will be added to the expedition at Cape Town.

column2: 1st known case of COVID-19 in non-captive wild mink found in US
column3: The first known case of COVID-19 in a non-captive wild mink has been confirmed, according to an alert issued by the US Department of Agriculture. The wild mink tested positive around an infected mink farm in Utah. The strain of the virus in the wild mink is "indistinguishable" from that in infected mink on farms around the state.

column2: Men remove metal monolith from US mountain and replace it with cross
column3: A metal monolith that appeared atop a mountain in the US state of California has been removed by a group of men. A video of the men surfaced online, in which they can be heard chanting "America First" and "Christ is King". The group replaced the metal monolith with a wooden cross.

column2: Bill Gates-led clean tech fund Breakthrough Energy raises $1 billion
column3: Clean tech venture capital fund Breakthrough Energy Ventures, led by Bill Gates, has raised $1 billion for a second round of investments which will be used to fund 40-50 startups. The fund previously backed 45 startups with initial $1 billion. Created in 2016, the principal investors of Breakthrough's first fund included Jeff Bezos, Mukesh Ambani, Richard Branson and Jack Ma.

column2: US House passes resolution urging Pence to invoke 25th Amendment
column3: US House on Tuesday passed a resolution calling Vice President Mike Pence to use 25th Amendment to remove President Donald Trump from office for inciting riots at the US Capitol last week. The House voted 223-205 to approve the resolution. Ahead of the vote, Pence had sent a letter to Speaker Nancy Pelosi refusing to invoke the 25th Amendment.

column2: 'Cruel' Trump belongs in prison after he leaves White House: Niece
column3: US President Donald Trump's niece Mary Trump has said that her "criminal, cruel and traitorous" uncle belongs in prison after he leaves the White House. "I think it would be a tragedy if Donald and everybody who's enabled him and committed crimes with him is not held accountable," she added. Mary is the daughter of Trump's elder brother Fred Jr.

column2: Vote recount fight about ensuring US has faith in elections: Trump
column3: US President Donald Trump said that his fight for recounting of votes is to ensure that "Americans can have faith in this election, and in all future elections". Trump alleged that the "corrupt mail-in balloting scheme that Democrats systematically put into place" allowed votes to be altered. Several election officials have said there was no evidence of massive voters fraud.

column2: Highest levels of microplastics found in molluscs among seafood: Study
column3: Researchers from the Hull York Medical School and the University of Hull have said mussels, oysters and scallops have the highest levels of microplastic contamination among seafood.  Molluscs collected off the coasts of Asia were the most heavily contaminated. The study looked at more than 50 studies between 2014 and 2020.

column2: My entire journey has been special: Kiara on B'wood journey
column3: Speaking about her journey in the Hindi film industry, Kiara Advani said her entire journey has been special. "For me, I think every film mattered, right from my first film because that's what gave me my first step into...film industry," Kiara said, adding, "People...say 'Kabir Singh' and 'Lust Stories' but every film has been a turning point in my life."

column2: Aprilia SXR 160 is here to maximise your life: Piaggio India
column3: The all-new Aprilia SXR 160 brings together a premium combination of style, performance and extraordinary comfort for an unbelievable riding experience, the company mentioned. Designed in Italy for India, it represents the new Aprilia design philosophy. Here's a ride that will transform your everyday experiences and lead you to maximise every one of them, the company added.

column2: Vikrant Massey to star in Hindi remake of Malayalam film 'Forensic'
column3: Actor Vikrant Massey will star in the Hindi remake of the Malayalam thriller film, 'Forensic', which released earlier this year. He will essay the role of a meticulous forensic officer, portrayed by Tovino Thomas in the original. Talking about the film, Vikrant said, "It's an intelligent film that keeps you on tenterhooks. At the same time, it's an out-and-out entertainer."

column2: Akshay charges ₹99 crore for 'Bachchan Pandey': Reports
column3: Akshay Kumar reportedly charged ₹99 crore for Sajid Nadiadwala's 'Bachchan Pandey'. "While Akshay's market value per film is around ₹110-₹120 crore, he couldn't say no to Sajid's request to cut down on fees for 'Bachchan Pandey' considering the pandemic situation," reports said. "The two finally zeroed in on ₹99 crore as the acting fees for Akshay," reports added.

column2: I'm still dealing with it: Trishala on coping with boyfriend's death
column3: Sanjay Dutt's daughter Trishala Dutt, during a QnA session on Instagram, responded to a fan who asked how she coped with the death of her boyfriend. Trishala wrote, "I'm still dealing with it, but I've gotten a lot of help...(and still getting help for it)." She added, "I spend time with my friends...family...and I'm doing a lot of soul searching."

column2: Cummins, Lyon will cause problems for India on Day 3: Ponting
column3: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that Australia pacer Pat Cummins and spinner Nathan Lyon will cause "a few" problems for India on the third day of the Sydney Test. "Cummins' spell [on the second day] was as good a fast bowling (spell) as you'll see. He was challenging every ball with just enough sideways movement," he added.

column2: Bihar Minister Ashok Choudhary gets additional charge of education dept
column3: Bihar Minister Ashok Choudhary has been given additional charge of the education department, following the resignation of Mewa Lal Choudhary over corruption allegations. Ashok Choudhary was earlier given charge of building construction, social welfare and minority affairs departments in the Nitish Kumar-led state government. They were sworn in to the state Cabinet on November 16.

column2: Ahana's newborn twins are biggest gifts for my b'day: Dharmendra
column3: Dharmendra, who turned 85 years old on December 8, has said his daughter Ahana Deol's newborn twins, Astraia and Adea, are the biggest gifts for his birthday. "And I got...gift in advance," he added. Ahana's twins were born on November 26. Talking about how he celebrated his birthday, Dharmendra said, "I don't celebrate my birthday these days after...mother passed away."

column2: I'm not worried: Richa on releasing Shakeela in theatres amid COVID-19
column3: Actress Richa Chadha, on being asked if she is worried about the theatrical release of 'Shakeela' amid the coronavirus pandemic, said, "No, I am not." "We are all living in strange times, so no point in being worried about something like this," she added. "I am hoping that people will want to watch Shakeela in theatres," Richa further said.

column2: Monitoring Brahmaputra river amid reports of Chinese construction: India
column3: India is "carefully monitoring all developments" on the Brahmaputra river after reports said China was looking to build a hydropower project on it, MEA spokesperson Anurag Srivastava said. "The government has consistently conveyed its...concerns to the Chinese authorities," he added. India has urged them to ensure interests of downstream states "aren't harmed" by upstream areas, he further said.

column2: Astronaut votes from ISS, NASA shares pic of voting booth
column3: NASA astronaut Kate Rubins cast her vote in the US Presidential election from the International Space Station (ISS). A photo shared by NASA Astronauts on Twitter showed Rubins in front of a handwritten sign that read "ISS voting booth". Rubins, the first person to sequence DNA in space, had earlier said that "it's critical to participate in our democracy".

column2: Maharashtra invites Tesla, holds video call with its executives
column3: Maharashtra has invited US electric-car maker Tesla, weeks after its Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk suggested entering India next year. In a tweet on Thursday, state Tourism and Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray said he and Industries Minister Subhash Desai held a video call with Tesla executives earlier in the day to invite them to the state.

column2: US planning to add Alibaba, Tencent to China investment blacklist: Report
column3: The Donald Trump-led administration is considering adding Chinese tech giants Alibaba and Tencent to a blacklist of firms it alleges are owned or controlled by the Chinese military, Reuters reported. The list already includes China’s top chipmaker SMIC and oil giant CNOOC. Alibaba and Tencent are among Asia's most valuable companies, with a combined net worth of $1.3 trillion.

column2: Parler CEO and his family go into hiding after receiving death threats
column3: Parler CEO John Matze has gone into hiding with his family after receiving death threats and security breaches, Matze's lawyer has revealed. Many Parler employees are also facing harassment and hostility and some of them have fled in order to escape persecution, the lawyer added. Earlier, Parler sued Amazon for discontinuing its services following the attack at the US Capitol.

column2: Fan who proposed to girlfriend in ODI reveals they met because of mail, shares pic
column3: Dipen Mandaliya, the India fan who proposed to his Australian girlfriend Rosilie Wimbush in the stands during the second Australia-India ODI in Sydney, revealed he met her for the first time due to a mail. He said when he moved to his Melbourne apartment in 2018, he had received mails meant for Rosilie and met her to return the mails.

column2: Each farmer in WB will get ₹18K in arrears if we win Assembly polls: BJP
column3: BJP National General Secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya on Friday said that if his party wins in the upcoming West Bengal Assembly elections, each farmer of the state would get ₹18,000 in arrears under PM Kisan Samman Nidhi scheme. "Farmers of Bengal will get their due once the Mamata Banerjee government is removed," he added. Vijayvargiya was addressing party workers in Nandigram.

column2: Facebook employees get 3 days off to 'take a break': Report
column3: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has given three days off to his employees worldwide as a reward for working through "unprecedented challenges" this year, CNBC reported. "The idea here is to give as many people as possible a break," Zuckerberg wrote in an email. Facebook employees in the US have received the entire week of Thanksgiving off.

column2: End Trump administration's rogue regime: Iran FM Zarif to Biden
column3: Iran's Foreign Minister Mohammad Javad Zarif has asked US President-elect Joe Biden to end the Trump administration's "rogue regime" and lift sanctions targeting Iran's oil and financial sectors. Zarif added that Iran would not renegotiate the 2015 nuclear deal. "The deal was about give and take, it wasn't about one side asking and the other side giving," he further said.

column2: 50-year-old problem of biology solved by Artificial Intelligence
column3: DeepMind's AI system 'AlphaFold' has been recognised as a solution to "protein folding", a grand challenge in biology for over 50 years. DeepMind showed it can predict how proteins fold into 3D shapes, a complex process that is fundamental to understanding the biological machinery of life. AlphaFold can predict the shape of proteins within the width of an atom.

column2: Doctors hear Mexican song while checking pulse in 65-year-old US man's feet
column3: A 65-year-old US man, who had undergone hip-replacement surgery, visited a hospital after experiencing a fall and dislocating his hip. When doctors assessed pulse in his feet using a Doppler device, they heard a Mexican song playing through the device's speaker. Doctors assume that Doppler might've picked up a radio signal that was being received by the patient's prosthetic hips.

column2: World's most-followed TikTok star loses 1 mn followers over a video controversy
column3: America's 16-year-old dancer Charli D'Amelio, the most-followed person on TikTok, lost 1 million followers after she was criticised over a video posted on her family's YouTube channel. In the video, she appeared to be complaining about not hitting 100 million followers and fans accused her sister of being rude to a chef. Charli was called "entitled" and "ungrateful" in comments.

column2: Nepotism is a time waste topic, my heart goes out to Johar: Lakshmi Manchu
column3: Actress-producer Lakshmi Manchu, who predominantly works in the South industry, spoke about the debate over nepotism and said that it's a "time waste topic". She added that it's unnecessarily bringing down the people who're doing the good work. "My heart goes out to Karan Johar, my heart bleeds for him because what they've done to him isn't right," Lakshmi said.

column2: Japan's worst bird flu outbreak on record spreads to 10th prefecture
column3: Japan's worst bird flu outbreak on record has spread to new farms and now affects over 20% of the country's 47 prefectures. The government said that around 11,000 birds will be slaughtered and buried after avian influenza was discovered at an egg farm in Higashiomi city in Shiga prefecture. Around 30 lakh birds have been culled in Japan so far.

column2: Car designer Dilip Chhabria of DC Design arrested in case of alleged cheating
column3: Renowned car designer Dilip Chhabria has been arrested in connection with an alleged cheating and forgery case, Mumbai Police said on Monday. Chhabria is the Founder of Indian design firm DC Design that makes concept cars and custom special order vehicles. One of his cars was also seized and Crime Branch said that there were more accused in the case.

column2: US cancels UN envoy's visit to Taiwan citing presidential transition
column3: US State Department has cancelled all travel plans scheduled for this week, including a trip by its UN Ambassador Kelly Craft to Taiwan due to presidential transition. Craft was due to begin the three-day visit on Wednesday and was scheduled to meet Taiwan President Tsai Ing-wen. Earlier, China had warned that US would pay a "heavy price" for the visit.

column2: Ball gets hidden inside batsman's sweater as he tries to steal single, video viral
column3: During the 20th over of Melbourne Stars innings against Sydney Thunder, the ball got stuck inside batsman Nick Larkin's sweater. Sydney Thunder fast bowler Daniel Sams bowled a length ball on stumps and Larkin got an inside edge and started running. The ball popped out of his sweater while he was running and the umpire called it a dead ball.

column2: Rahul Gandhi has no political 'aukaat' left, says RS Prasad
column3: Addressing a rally in Bihar amid the Assembly elections on Wednesday, Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad said, "Rahul Gandhi has no political 'aukaat' left... Nobody takes him seriously." Prasad made the statement after Rahul Gandhi said that "It is a matter of worry that the PM’s effigy was being torched" instead of Ravana's during Dussehra.

column2: Voice of desperation: Kamala Harris on Trump's Georgia phone call
column3: US Vice President-elect Kamala Harris has said that President Donald Trump's phone call with Georgia's top election official showed Trump's "voice of desperation". "It was bald-faced, bold abuse of power," she added. In the audio of the call that went viral, Trump pressurised the official to "find" enough votes to overturn his defeat in Georgia in the November 3 election.

column2: Int'l Space Station shares pics of full moon taken from '250 miles above Earth'
column3: The International Space Station on Sunday shared pictures of the full moon taken from space. "The full Moon occurs once a month and is a spectacular sight viewed from 250 miles above Earth," the space station captioned the pictures. Several people reacted to the pictures on Twitter, with a user saying, "That is a sensational picture."

column2: US carmakers ask for government's help amid global chip shortage
column3: The AAPC, a lobbying organisation for GM, Ford Motor and US operations of FCA, has asked the US government to help find a solution to the global chip shortage.
