"At times Home Minister is here, other times Chadda, Nadda, Fadda, Bhadda is here...they create a drama and claim they got thrashed," she added. Her comments came after BJP President JP Nadda's convoy was attacked in West Bengal.

column2: Varun Dhawan confirms he has COVID-19, says 'I could've been more careful'
column3: Actor Varun Dhawan on Monday confirmed he has tested positive for coronavirus. Sharing a screenshot of his video call with friends, Varun wrote, "VITAMIN FRIENDS...As I returned to work in the pandemic era I've contracted COVID-19." "All precautions were taken...but still nothing is certain in life...So please be extra careful I believe I could've been more careful," he added.

column2: Over 6 lakh Facebook users hit by large-scale ad phishing campaign
column3: A large-scale ad phishing campaign that has compromised accounts of around 6.15 lakh Facebook users from over 50 countries has been unearthed by cybersecurity firm ThreatNix. The campaign targets users through fake ads and redirects them to phishing sites hosted on GitHub pages. ThreatNix said the campaign targets countries including Nepal and Pakistan and is growing at a rapid pace.

column2: Bajaj Auto becomes world's most valuable two-wheeler company
column3: Pune-based Bajaj Auto has said that it has become the world's most valuable two-wheeler company as its market capitalisation crossed ₹1 lakh crore. Bajaj Auto achieved this milestone as it celebrates the 75th year of its operations. Bajaj Auto on Monday reported an 11% increase in total sales at 3,72,532 units in December 2020.

column2: Twitter user claims YouTuber given ₹65L for Sushant video, Dhruv Rathee replies
column3: YouTuber Dhruv Rathee responded to a claim that a "major YouTuber" has "been paid ₹65 lakh" to make a video "exposing role of Sushant Singh Rajput's family in his death". "Is this...fake news referring to me?...I'm not planning to make...[such] video," he tweeted. "I...wish my sponsoring fees was ₹30 lakh per video, how rich would I be," Dhruv added.

column2: PUBG Mobile to stop working for users in India from today
column3: PUBG Mobile announced that it is terminating service and access for users in India from today, two months after the government banned the game. PUBG Mobile had remained accessible for Indian users who already had it installed. Earlier, South Korea's PUBG Corp said it will no longer give China's Tencent Games the rights to publish the mobile game in India.

column2: Most Apple employees won't return to office until June: Report
column3: Apple CEO Tim Cook in a virtual meeting with employees said it "seems likely" that majority of teams won't be back before June, Bloomberg reported. Cook also implied that Apple's performance during lockdown could enable more flexibility to work remotely in future. He added Apple will be giving employees in many regions an additional paid holiday scheduled for January 4.

column2: 'Tenet' has infused life back into me, can't wait to work more: Dimple
column3: In a recent interview, actress Dimple Kapadia said that starring in Christopher Nolan's 'Tenet' acted as an "adrenaline shot" for her and added, "This film has really infused life back into me." She mentioned that after working in 'Tenet', she is looking forward to what she can explore in the future. Nolan's film also stars Robert Pattinson and Elizabeth Debicki.

column2: Tesla asked to give ₹1 cr to used car buyer for hiding damage in China
column3: Tesla was ordered by a Chinese court to pay over ₹1 crore to the buyer of a used Model S car after concluding it concealed structural damage on the vehicle it sold on its official website. It was reportedly discovered part of the vehicle had been cut and welded back together. Tesla will appeal the ruling to a higher court.

column2: Not thinking about opposition, want to keep momentum: Rohit on MI vs SRH
column3: MI skipper Rohit Sharma has said that all the hard work paid off as his side qualified for the playoffs of the ongoing IPL season. "Now, one hurdle has been crossed, another small little tournament to play for us...we have one more game...we don't want to think about the opposition, we just want to...keep the momentum going," he added.

column2: Alphabet's Waymo to no longer use the term 'self-driving' for its tech
column3: Alphabet's subsidiary Waymo has said that it will no longer use the term "self-driving" to describe the technology it has been developing. The company will, instead, be opting for the term "autonomous". "Waymo's vehicles don't drive themselves. Rather, Waymo is automating the task of driving and thus the term "autonomous driving" is more accurate," the company said.

column2: Internal storage quota issue caused 45-minute worldwide outage: Google
column3: Google in a statement on Monday said that it experienced an authentication system outage for approximately 45 minutes due to an "internal storage quota issue". "This was resolved and all services are now restored," Google added. "We apologise to everyone affected, and we'll conduct a thorough follow up review to ensure this problem cannot recur in the future," Google said.

column2: Bhiku Mhatre has given me a career: Manoj on his character in 'Satya'
column3: Actor Manoj Bajpayee, who played gangster Bhiku Mhatre in the 1998 Ram Gopal Varma directorial 'Satya', said the character gave him a career in the film industry. "I feel lucky that I was blessed with that kind of a role which changed a lot of things for me...people still remember Bhiku Mhatre with so much fondness," he added.

column2: Human-made objects to outweigh living things by the end of 2020: Study
column3: Scientists have said that the weight of human-made objects will likely exceed that of living things by the end of the year. In a study published in the scientific journal Nature, scientists compared the overall living biomass on Earth, estimated to be around 1.1 teratonnes, to human-made mass. "We find that Earth is exactly at the crossover point," they said.

column2: Found Rahane's captaincy to be fabulous: Ian Chappell
column3: Former Australia captain Ian Chappell praised Ajinkya Rahane's leadership ahead of the Test series against Australia. "I saw him captain in one Test against Australia (in Dharamshala in March 2017) and found his captaincy to be fabulous. He was really an aggressive captain," Ian said. Rahane will lead in the Test series as Virat returns home after the first Test.

column2: Amazon India's largest seller's supplies hit after GST registration suspension
column3: Cloudtail India, the largest seller on Amazon India, suffered a major supply disruption after its GST registration was suspended in Haryana, which is its warehousing hub. The suspension was revoked after 20 hours, leading to confusion among vendors and ultimately a 1-2 day delay for inbound shipments. No specific reason for the suspension was stated.

column2: Ashwin mocks Paine over 'Gabba' sledge, tweets 'Good evening from Gabba' after win
column3: Following Team India's victory at the Gabba, off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin mocked Australia captain Tim Paine over the 'Can't wait to get you to Gabba' sledge. Tagging Paine in a tweet, Ashwin wrote, "Good evening from Gabba!" He added, "I am sorry I couldn’t play here but thanks for hosting us and playing some hard cricket during these tough times."

column2: Apple removes macOS feature that let its apps bypass firewalls: Report
column3: Apple's macOS Big Sur 11.2 beta 2 has eliminated feature that allowed 53 Apple apps to bypass third-party firewalls, security tools, and VPN apps, ZDNet reported. The macOS Big Sur 11 included a ContentFilterExclusionList that let apps like the App Store and iCloud bypass firewalls. Researchers had earlier warned of security issues the list could cause.

column2: Out ho ja bhootni ke: Pak spinner heard saying on stump mic as batsman misses ball
column3: Pakistan leg-spinner Yasir Shah was heard saying 'Out ho ja bhootni ke' on stump mic in frustration after New Zealand batsman Henry Nicholls missed a cut shot on his bowling in first Test today. Reacting to it, a fan tweeted, "Hahaha top stuff with tongue but bowling [thumbs down]." Nicholls is unbeaten on 42 off 100 deliveries after day one.

column2: ESA-NASA's 'Solar Orbiter' probe completes its first Venus flyby
column3: The joint ESA-NASA Solar Orbiter spacecraft completed its first flyby of Venus. Solar Orbiter reached its closest approach to Venus when the spacecraft was about 7,500 kilometres from Venus' cloud tops. During the flyby, Solar Orbiter gathered data that could provide insights into how Venus interacts with solar winds.

column2: Kangana's tweets portray farmers protest as anti-national: DSGMC chief
column3: Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC) chief Manjinder Singh Sirsa has sent a legal notice to actress Kangana Ranaut for her tweet on 'Shaheen Bagh Dadi' Bilkis Bano and saying that she is a woman "available for ₹100". "Her tweets portray farmers protest as anti-national," Sirsa said. Kangana "misidentified" an old woman at the ongoing farmers' protest as Bilkis Bano.

column2: Fiat Chrysler, US startup Archer partner to build electric aircraft
column3: Fiat Chrysler and US-based startup Archer have partnered to produce an electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft. FCA will provide input that contributes to Archer's eVTOL cockpit's design, among other things. The aircraft will be powered by an electric motor and will be able to fly about 96 kilometres high at a ​top speed of around 241 kilometres/hour.

column2: Pele, Maradona, Messi, Ronaldo part of Ballon d'Or Dream Team
column3: France Football on Monday announced the Ballon d'Or Dream 11 which included Pele, Diego Maradona, Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo. Russia's Lev Yashin was named the goalkeeper. Brazil's Cafu, Germany's Franz Beckenbauer and Italy's Paolo Maldini are manning the defence. Xavi, Germany's Lothar Matthaus, Pele and Maradona complete the midfield. Ronaldo, Messi and Brazil's Ronaldo are up front.

column2: Deforestation in Amazon destroyed area bigger than Spain in 18 yrs: Study
column3: Deforestation in the Amazon destroyed an area bigger than Spain from 2000 to 2018, wiping out 8% of the world's biggest rainforest,  a study by RAISG said. An atlas of the region showed that 5.13 lakh square kilometres of the rainforest has been lost since 2000. The highest loss of 49,240 square kilometres was recorded in 2003.

column2: Kelly's husband seeks $436K in support amid divorce proceedings: Reports
column3: American singer Kelly Clarkson's estranged husband Brandon Blackstock has asked for $436,000 per month in child and spousal support amid the ongoing divorce proceedings, E! Online reported. The amount of support was reportedly cited in court documents filed on November 30. The singer filed for divorce from her husband in June after nearly seven years of marriage.

column2: Ad showing man eating bat sandwich being investigated in Australia
column3: An advertisement that shows a man eating a bat sandwich is being investigated by Ad Standards, Australia's advertising watchdog. Released by outdoor equipment retailer, Boating Camping Fishing store (BCF), a man in the ad jokes that the COVID-19 pandemic was caused by someone eating a bat. The ad, uploaded in December on YouTube, has been viewed nearly 2.6 lakh times.

column2: Chinese e-comm firm faces labour probe after employee's death: Report
column3: Chinese e-commerce platform Pinduoduo is facing a review of its working conditions from government officials after disclosing the death of a female employee, state-owned Beijing Youth Daily reported. Her death renewed criticism of the "996" work culture, commonly practised in Chinese tech companies, where employees work from 9 am to 9 pm, six days a week.

column2: Dropbox to cut 11% of its global workforce, COO to step down
column3: Dropbox on Wednesday said it will be cutting its global workforce by approximately 11%, a move that will affect 315 people. "I made a commitment to...preserve job security through 2020," CEO Drew Houston said, adding that the layoff was necessary to "create a healthy and thriving business for future". Further, COO Olivia Nottebohm will be leaving Dropbox on February 5.

column2: People still punish Congress whenever there is a chance: PM Modi
column3: Addressing a rally on Tuesday in the wake of the Bihar polls, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "The Congress does not even have a total of 100 MPs in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha...The public still punishes them whenever there is a chance." PM Modi added, "Look at what condition the public has put Congress party in."

column2: Bigg Boss 14 contestant Rahul Vaidya's mom confirms he'll marry Disha Parmar
column3: Bigg Boss 14 contestant Rahul Vaidya's mother Geeta has confirmed that her son will marry actress Disha Parmar this year. Talking to The Times of India, Geeta said, "We're waiting for Rahul to come out [of the show], the moment he's out, [we'll]...finalise the dates." She added, "Disha doesn't want to get married in summer, so mostly we'll have...June wedding."

column2: Cong holds nationwide protests against farm laws, observes 'Kisan Adhikar Diwas'
column3: Congress party on Friday observed 'Kisan Adhikar Diwas' and held nationwide protests outside Governor houses against the farm laws and to show solidarity with the protesting farmers. "We demand that the government should repeal these laws. We and farmers are not going to withdraw the protest till...the demands of the farmers are met," senior Congress leader KC Venugopal said.

column2: Biden's team adds hidden message for coders in new White House website
column3: The redesigned website for US President Joe Biden's White House carried a hidden invitation for coders to join the US Digital Service, a technology unit within the White House. "If you're reading this, we need your help building back better," a line in the site's HTML source code reads. The new website also has dark mode and font size selector.

column2: No-deal Brexit very, very likely: UK PM Boris Johnson
column3: UK PM Boris Johnson has said that it looks "very, very likely" that the country will leave the European Union without a deal but it "will be wonderful for the UK". He added that talks were snagged on fishing rights and business competition rules. Earlier, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said a no-deal was the most probable outcome.

column2: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
column3: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

column2: 60 farmer deaths don't embarrass Centre, tractor rally does: Rahul
column3: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday said the death of over 60 people amid the farmers' protest "is not an embarrassment for the Centre but a tractor rally is". This comes after the Centre submitted an affidavit in the Supreme Court which said that the march which seeks to disrupt Republic Day celebrations "will cause an embarrassment to the nation".

column2: We 'inadvertently' limited engagement on Trump's flagged tweets: Twitter
column3: After The Verge reported that some users on Twitter were unable to like, reply or retweet US President Donald Trump's tweets, Twitter said it "inadvertently" limited engagements on his tweets that were labelled as "disputed" for a brief period of time but later reversed its action. A Twitter spokesperson said Twitter will continue to label tweets that violate its policies.

column2: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
column3: You can now drive a new car every month as Revv provides the option to subscribe to your favourite car for 1-36 months with ₹0 down payment, ₹0 road tax and without the hassle of maintenance and service. The car will be sanitized and delivered to your doorstep ensuring complete safety for you and your loved ones.

column2: Apple removes 39,000 game apps on China store in biggest single day removal
column3: Apple on Thursday removed over 46,000 apps on its China store, including 39,000 game apps, marking the biggest removal ever in a single day. The apps were removed as December 31 was the deadline for all game publishers to obtain a licence. Only 74 of the top 1,500 paid games on Apple store were not removed, according to Qimai.

column2: Tesla starts delivering Shanghai-made Model Y SUVs in China
column3: Tesla on Monday said that it has started delivering the Shanghai-made Model Y sports utility vehicles (SUVs) to its customers in China. The starting price of the Model Y vehicle has been set at 3,39,900 yuan (about $52,400). Tesla received permission from the Chinese government to start selling its cars in November last year.

column2: Show is a work of fiction: Sunil Grover on 'Tandav' controversy
column3: Commenting on the ongoing controversy surrounding his web series 'Tandav', actor Sunil Grover said, "This is a work of fiction. Politics, of course, is always a topic of conversation in our country." He further explained "The show was shot last year, so a lot of things in it hadn't happened yet in real life. But they happened later."

column2: Malware campaign adding extensions in Chrome, Firefox: Microsoft
column3: Google Chrome, Firefox and other browsers are affected by an ongoing malware campaign that is designed to inject ads into search results and add malicious browser extensions, Microsoft reported. Dubbed Adrozek, the malware family has been at scale since at least May. Its attacks peaked in August with the threat being noticed on more than 30,000 devices every day.

column2: I believe staying in the moment, Virat is our captain now: Rahane on captaining
column3: On being asked about captaining India in the final three Tests against Australia, Test vice-captain Ajinkya Rahane said he'll think about it after the first Test. "I believe staying in the moment...Right now, Virat is our captain. We think about this Test match and then after that when he leaves, we will think [about final three]," he stated.

column2: Naked fugitive found in crocodile-infested waters in Australia, ate snails to survive
column3: A naked fugitive sitting on a tree branch in crocodile-infested waters was found by two fishermen near Australia's Darwin. The man was covered in mud, cuts and insect bites. The fishermen said the fugitive told them that he had been lost for four days and survived by eating snails. He was wanted for allegedly breaching bail over an armed robbery.

column2: People still punish Congress whenever there is a chance: PM Modi
column3: Addressing a rally on Tuesday in the wake of the Bihar polls, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said, "The Congress does not even have a total of 100 MPs in the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha...The public still punishes them whenever there is a chance." PM Modi added, "Look at what condition the public has put Congress party in."

column2: Tesla's success should justify its share price: Raghuram Rajan
column3: Economist and former Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Raghuram Rajan said Tesla's success and spread of vehicles must be viewed firmly and should justify its rising stock price. He added that Tesla is a case of a stock that's being priced at many multiples of the price of automakers such as Toyota or General Motors.

column2: Google India FY20 revenue rises 35% to ₹5,594 cr, profit rises 24%
column3: Google India has reported a rise of nearly 35% year-on-year in its revenue for the financial year 2019-20 to ₹5,594 crore. Its net profit for the period was higher by about 24% at over ₹586 crore as compared to approximately ₹472 crore in the financial year 2018-19. Google India also saw its total expenses rise 30.4% to over ₹4,455 crore.

column2: Big Tech made a terrible mistake: Trump on his social media ban
column3: US President Donald Trump on Tuesday said that the Big Tech has committed a "terrible mistake" by banning him from social media platforms. "I think that Big Tech is doing a horrible thing for our country...it's going to be a catastrophic mistake for them," he added. Several online platforms suspended Trump's accounts after the attack at US Capitol last week.

column2: NASA takes pic of 'Wolf Moon'; shares the story behind the name
column3: NASA shared a picture of 'Wolf Moon', the 13th and final full Moon of 2020 that will be visible for about three days. NASA said the Algonquin tribes of what is now the northern and eastern US named it 'Wolf Moon' as packs of wolves howled hungrily outside villages in winter. Another name for it is 'Ice Moon', NASA said.

column2: It's most challenging role I've done till now: Manav on Nail Polish
column3: Actor Manav Kaul, while talking about his role in 'Nail Polish', said that it's the most challenging role he has done till now. "I couldn't sleep for days," he added. "I remember just two days before the shoot of...Charu Raina sequence, late in the night, I texted (director) Bugs that I'm scared, which hasn't happened to me before," said Manav.

column2: US accuses China of genocide against Uighur Muslims in Xinjiang
column3: US Secretary of State Mike Pompeo has accused China of committing "genocide and crimes against humanity" against Uighur Muslims and other minority groups in Xinjiang province. "We are witnessing the systematic attempt to destroy Uighurs by the Chinese party-state," he added. The US has determined that this has been going on since at least March 2017, he further said.

column2: Never-before-seen particle found in blood of septic patients: Study
column3: La Jolla Institute for Immunology researchers have discovered that people with sepsis have "never-before-seen" particles called 'ENDS' in their blood. They showed that these particles break off of immune cells and change their shape as they course through the body. Compared with healthy subjects, the researchers showed that ENDS are around 100-fold more detectable in septic patients.

column2: Joe Biden, Kamala Harris named TIME's 2020 Person of the Year
column3: US President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris have been named TIME's 2020 Person of the Year. "For changing American story, for showing that forces of empathy are greater than the furies of division, for sharing a vision of healing in a grieving world, Biden and Harris are TIME's 2020 Person of the Year," TIME editor-in-chief Edward Felsenthal wrote.

column2: Bombay HC rejects Sonu Sood's bail plea against BMC notice
column3: The Bombay High Court has dismissed actor Sonu Sood's appeal and interim application against Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation's (BMC) notice on alleged illegal construction at his Mumbai residence. Sood's lawyer had sought 10 weeks to comply with the BMC's notice. The court, however, dismissed the appeal and said Sood had ample opportunity in the past.

column2: BJP rolls out red carpet for billionaires, digs roads for farmers: Priyanka
column3: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Saturday said that the BJP rolls out a red carpet for their "billionaire friends" but has dug up roads as farmers are trying to enter Delhi. Priyanka added, "You made laws against farmers...but if the farmers come...to raise their concerns, is it wrong?"  She was criticising the BJP-led central government amid the farmers' protest.

column2: Virat-Anushka seen for 1st time post child's birth, thank media for respecting privacy
column3: Team India Captain Virat Kohli and his wife, actress Anushka Sharma, were seen in public for first time after their daughter's birth on January 11. "Thank you for respecting," said Anushka while referring to the couple's request to media photographers to "not take or carry any content" that has their child. "We'll...ensure...you get all the content...featuring us," they had said.

column2: We'll be going to Supreme Court, want all voting to stop: Trump alleges fraud
column3: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday alleged that fraud was underway with the vote count in the Presidential election. "We'll be going to the US Supreme Court. We want all voting to stop," Trump added. "We were getting ready to win this election. Frankly, we did win this election," Trump further said.

column2: We're going to have more vaccines than we can possibly use: Elon Musk
column3: In a recent interview, Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said, "We're going to have so many (COVID-19) vaccines, we won't know what to do with them. More...than we can possibly use." Musk has earlier been criticised for saying "the coronavirus panic is dumb" and even claiming the US will see "close to zero new cases" by April 2020.

column2: AAP spends more on advertisements than healthcare: Congress
column3: Congress' National Spokesperson Pawan Khera has accused the AAP-led Delhi government of spending more on advertisements than the healthcare facilities amid the COVID-19 pandemic. "Very unfortunate that people of Delhi are suffering the consequences of mistakes committed by the Delhi government," Khera said. He added that it is appalling that AAP has only spent 25% of the health budget.

column2: Why should protests take place in America & London for farmers?: MoS
column3: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs G Kishan Reddy on Monday said that why should demonstrations take place in America, Canada and London in support of farmers' protests happening in India. He added, "Who is behind this? Some people want to carry out anti-India activities by misusing your (farmers') name. I request farmers to remain vigilant."

column2: Toyota halts operations at Karnataka plant as union strike continues
column3: Toyota Motor Corporation again halted operations at its car plant in Karnataka's Bidadi from Monday, as members of its workers' union continued a strike after the suspension of a worker wasn't withdrawn. Earlier, Toyota Kirloskar Motor (TKM) had declared a lockout at both its plants in Bidadi on November 10. The company said that the union had compromised COVID-19 guidelines.

column2: Hyundai, Kia agree to $210M US penalty for delay in vehicles' recall
column3: Hyundai and Kia Motors have agreed to $140 million and $70 million civil penalties, respectively, after US auto safety regulators said they delayed recall of 1.6 million vehicles for engine issues. The settlement covers recall in 2015 and 2017 for manufacturing issues. Kia denied the allegations but agreed to settle the matter to "avoid a protracted dispute with the government".

column2: Sunny denies reports of getting Y-category security after speaking on protests
column3: Actor and BJP MP Sunny Deol has denied reports that he was given Y-category security by the government after he expressed his views on the ongoing farmers' protests. Taking to Twitter, Sunny wrote that he has been accorded Y-category security since July 2020. "An attempt has been made to link this security provision to...ongoing...protest which is wrong," he added.

column2: Pic of vehicle that exploded in 'intentional act' in US released
column3: Police in Nashville, US, released the picture of the camper van that broadcast a warning to residents before it blew up on Friday, in what police believe was an "intentional act". Possible human remains have been found at the scene of the explosion, police said. Three people were injured in the morning blast, though none critically.

column2: AAP is viable alternative in Mumbai: Atishi on 2022 BMC polls
column3: AAP leader Atishi on Friday said, "Aam Aadmi Party is presenting itself as a viable alternative and will contest all 227 seats in the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) polls in 2022." She added, "Shiv Sena only seems to be concerned about large contracts. No wonder it passed 300 proposals in a single sitting of the BMC's standing committee recently."

column2: Wish you were here: Riddhima shares pics of late father Rishi
column3: Riddhima Kapoor Sahni took to Instagram to post throwback pictures of her late father Rishi Kapoor. She captioned the post, "You are missed everyday! Wish you were here with us. We love you." Rishi Kapoor passed away at the age of 67 in April this year after battling leukemia for more than two years.

column2: Italy starts its biggest mafia trial in 30 yrs with over 350 suspects
column3: Italy on Wednesday began its biggest mafia trial in nearly 30 years with over 350 suspected gangsters and their associates in the dock on several charges. The case targets Calabria-based 'Ndrangheta crime syndicate, which prosecutors consider to be Italy's most powerful mafia group. Over 900 witnesses are expected to testify in the trial.

column2: Uyghur women not 'emancipated' by forced abortions: US on China's tweet
column3: US State Secretary Mike Pompeo has reacted to Chinese embassy's tweet which claimed Uyghur women had their minds "emancipated" by their policies and that they were no longer "baby-making machines". "Uyghur women are not 'emancipated' by forced abortions and sterilizations," Pompeo tweeted. China has been rebuked globally for cracking down on Uyghur Muslims by sending them to detention camps.

column2: I do it for my own amusement: Ranveer on his fashion choices
column3: Commenting on his "whimsical" fashion choices, Ranveer Singh said, "I do it for my own amusement...playing 'dress-up' is fun for me. I am always attracted to original, distinctive and unique expression." He also mentioned that he decided to be authentic with his choices and be true to himself after his "life-altering" back injury during the shooting of his film 'Lootera'.

column2: Exhausting to be constantly funny, I don't post obsessively anymore: Mallika Dua
column3: Actor-comedian Mallika Dua said she doesn't post obsessively anymore as it's exhausting to be constantly funny. "It started as, 'you're good at it, you should do more' then it became 'if you don't do it, you won’t make money'," Dua said. "Then it transformed into 'you must do it because others are doing it...and you must be better'," she added.

column2: Depriving liberty even for one day is one too many: SC on Goswami's plea
column3: Stating that the Bombay High Court had "abdicated" its responsibility while dealing with Republic TV's Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami's plea, the Supreme Court said, "Deprivation of liberty even for a single day is one day too many." It added, "Our courts must ensure that they continue to remain the first line of defence against the deprivation of the liberty of citizens."

column2: Woman offers to donate her eggs to help father, ex-boyfriend have a baby
column3: A 21-year old woman from UK's Manchester has offered to donate her eggs to help her father and ex-boyfriend have a baby. Saffron's father Barrie Drewitt-Barlow is one of UK's first gay dads. Barrie welcomed his first daughter via surrogacy with his partner Scott Hutchison, who had previously dated Saffron, in September this year.

column2: Gulf states to restore trade link with Qatar within a week: UAE
column3: Gulf states could resume travel and trade links with Qatar within a week of signing an agreement on January 5 to end their dispute, UAE Minister of State for Foreign Affairs Anwar Gargash said. However, restoring diplomatic ties will take time, he added. "Some issues are easier to fix and some others will take a longer time," Gargash further said.

column2: If Natarajan can be consistent, it'll be great heading into WC next year: Kohli
column3: India skipper Virat Kohli has praised 29-year-old pacer T Natarajan for his performance in the three-match T20I series against Australia. "In absence of Bumrah and Shami, Natarajan has been the guy who stood up and delivered...if he can be consistent it will be a great thing for us heading into the T20 WC next year," Kohli stated.

column2: One of most remote islands to create 4th largest marine protection zone
column3: Tristan da Cunha, one of the most remote islands in the world, is creating a marine protection zone to safeguard endangered wildlife in an area of the South Atlantic. The sanctuary will be the fourth biggest "no-take zone" in the world. Fishing and other "extractive activities" will be banned from an area of 6.27 lakh square kilometres.

column2: Pakistan's coronavirus cases exceed 5 lakh-mark
column3: Pakistan's total coronavirus cases rose to 5,02,416 after 2,899 new cases were reported on Sunday, the country's Health Ministry said. Of these, Pakistan's Sindh province reported the highest number of cases at 1,505, followed by Punjab at 798 and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa at 397. Pakistan reported 46 deaths from coronavirus during the same period, taking the total death toll to 10,644.

column2: California voters classify Uber, Lyft drivers as contractors, not employees
column3: Uber and Lyft have won the most expensive ballot contest, the Proposition 22 ballot measure, that classifies app-based ride-hailing and food delivery drivers' status as independent contractors. With more than 80% of the vote reported in California, 58% of voters supported the proposition that exempts Uber and Lyft from spending over $392 million each on employee-related expenses, Reuters reported.

column2: 18 fishermen held in Libya freed after more than 100 days: Italy
column3: Eighteen fishermen who were held in Libya for more than 100 days for allegedly fishing in Libyan waters have been freed, Italy said. Italian Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio said that he and PM Giuseppe Conte went to Benghazi to bring the fishermen back. The group includes eight Italians, six Tunisians, two Indonesians and two Senegalese, AFP reported.

column2: Time spent with Team India best time of my life: Natarajan
column3: India bowler T Natarajan has described the last few months with Team India as the 'best time of his life'. "The last couple of months have been surreal...Playing Test cricket for India was a dream...Overwhelmed with your support," Natarajan tweeted. Natarajan came to Australia as a net bowler but went on to make his India debut in all three formats.

column2: Chip shortage forces Ford, Toyota, Nissan to cut vehicle production
column3: Ford, Toyota, Fiat Chrysler and Nissan said that they would cut vehicle production this month due to a shortage of semiconductors. Honda has also said its output in Japan could be affected by a shortage of semiconductors. Ford said it will idle its Louisville assembly plant. Fiat Chrysler will be delaying the restart of production at its Toluca plant.

column2: FC Kohli, known as 'Father of Indian software industry', passes away at 96
column3: Faqir Chand Kohli, the founding CEO of TCS who was often called the 'Father of the Indian software industry', passed away at the age of 96 on Thursday. He was actively involved in the decision to bring IBM to India as part of Tata-IBM in 1991. A Padma Bhushan awardee, he also served as chairman of NASSCOM in the 1990s.

column2: Malaysia's ex-PM's tweet justifying beheadings in France deleted by Twitter
column3: Former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad's tweet justifying the recent beheading attacks in France has been deleted by Twitter. "Muslims have a right to be angry and to kill millions of French people for the massacres of the past," he had tweeted. Twitter removed the tweet by Mohamad for glorifying violence.

column2: Modi govt's apathy, arrogance has claimed lives of 60 farmers: Rahul
column3: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that Modi government's apathy and arrogance have claimed lives of over 60 farmers. "Instead of wiping their tears, GOI is busy attacking them with tear gas," Rahul said. He added, "Such brutality, just to promote crony capitalists' business interests. Repeal the anti-farm laws."

column2: F1 driver who escaped burning car after 225-kmph crash shares video from hospital
column3: Formula One driver Romain Grosjean, whose car burst into flames and split into two after a 225-kmph crash at the Bahrain Grand Prix, took to social media to share a video from hospital. "Hello everyone, I just wanted to say I am ok, well, sort of ok," Grosjean said in the video showing his bandaged hands.

column2: Tesla to start delivering its China-made Model Y SUVs this month
column3: Tesla has started selling China-made Model Y SUV and will deliver them to customers this month. The starting price of a Model Y in China is now $52,028.16, according to its China website. Tesla recently launched its largest Supercharger station in China. The new station has 72 stalls of Tesla's V2 Supercharger, which can output 150 kW.

column2: Ranbir & Alia are not getting engaged in Ranthambore today: Randhir Kapoor
column3: Actor and Ranbir Kapoor's uncle, Randhir Kapoor, has denied reports that claimed Ranbir and his girlfriend, actress Alia Bhatt are getting engaged in Ranthambore. "If [they] were to get engaged today, my family and I would have also been there with them. Ranbir, Alia and Neetu have gone there for holidays and to bring in the new year," he stated.

column2: No action against anyone for revenge: Sanjay Raut on Arnab's arrest
column3: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has said that no action was taken against anyone for revenge since the formation of Thackeray government in Maharashtra. He said the police can take action if they have evidence against someone. This comes after Republic TV's Arnab Goswami was arrested for allegedly abetting the suicide of an interior designer and his mother in 2018.

column2: U'khand CM apologises to Cong leader after state BJP chief calls her 'budhiya'
column3: Uttarakhand Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat has apologised to the Leader of Opposition in state Assembly after state BJP chief Bansidhar Bhagat called her "budhiya". A delegation of Congress leaders led by state party chief Pritam Singh met DGP Ashok Kumar and gave a letter demanding an FIR against Bhagat under appropriate sections for his remaks.

column2: 7,000 people booked for violence at Karnataka's iPhone manufacturing plant
column3: A total of 7,000 people were booked, including 5,000 contract workers, in connection with the violence and vandalism at Wistron iPhone manufacturing plant in Karnataka's Kolar. Employees vandalised the plant due to non-payment of salaries. Wistron has clarified that the incident caused up to ₹52 crore in losses, a day after estimating damages worth ₹440 crore in a police complaint.

column2: Next round of talks between India-China on LAC standoff soon: MEA
column3: The Ministry of External Affairs on Thursday said there would soon be another round of talks between India and China with the aim of complete disengagement and full restoration of peace and tranquillity along the LAC. Earlier, in reference to the India-China standoff, the MEA had stated, "When we have something to share, we will share."

column2: Arjun Rampal's sister summoned by NCB, set to appear before agency today
column3: Arjun Rampal's sister Komal Rampal has been summoned by Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) in Mumbai at 11 am on Wednesday. Notably, this comes after the NCB questioned Arjun and his partner Gabriella Demetriades as part of an investigation in relation to alleged drug links in Bollywood. "I have never been on the wrong side of the law," Arjun had said.

column2: US diplomats asked to stop social media posts after US Capitol violence: Report
column3: US State Department has reportedly asked diplomats overseas to suspend all social media posts after President Donald Trump's supporters stormed the US Capitol on Wednesday. They've been asked to remove scheduled content for Facebook and Twitter, reported CNN. The State Department has only retweeted a thread by Secretary of State Michael Pompeo's account saying, the violence was unacceptable.

column2: Indian tech firms received $38B during COVID-19: Amitabh Kant
column3: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant said that Indian tech companies have witnessed over $38 billion investment in the last five to six months while the world was reeling under the impact of COVID-19. While speaking at the TiE Global Summit, he added that India is currently home to 34 unicorn startups and 52 soonicorns (soon to be unicorns).

column2: BJP launched campaign to divide farmers, defame movement: Akhilesh
column3: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday said that the farmers are agitating for the past 20 days and instead of listening to them, the government has adopted a stubborn attitude. He added, "Not only this, but the BJP has also launched a campaign to divide farmers and discredit the movement and defame it."

column2: Just can't believe the day has come: Parthiv's wife shares note on his retirement
column3: After wicketkeeper-batsman Parthiv Patel announced his retirement from all forms of cricket, his wife Avni took to Twitter to share a note. "Dear husband...I just can't believe the day has come," she wrote. She added, "I know how hard it's to say goodbye to cricket. Even for us...Looking forward to spend more weekends and holidays we both have dreamed of."

column2: No need to play Bumrah in all 4 Tests vs Eng, need to look after him: Gambhir
column3: After India pacer Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out of the Brisbane Test due to an abdominal strain, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said there's no need to play Bumrah in all four upcoming Tests against England at home in February-March. He added that it's important to look after him for India's tour of England and the T20 World Cup.

column2: Ajay Jadeja trolls Ravindra over ice pack on shoulder, says 'Ice should be in glass'
column3: While interacting with Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja following his match-winning performance against Australia in the third ODI, Ajay Jadeja enquired about the ice pack on his shoulder, saying, "I am worried." Ajay jokingly added, "Ice should be in glass," to which Ravindra responded, "Actually, it's night here. You are right ice should be in glass."

column2: Complaint filed against Poonam for shooting 'porn' video on govt property in Goa
column3: The women's wing of Goa Forward Party filed a complaint against actress Poonam Pandey for shooting an alleged vulgar video at Chapoli Dam. "The shooting of this porn video...has shocked the people of Canacona, famous for its culture," the complaint read. "We are shocked how this video was shot at the government property and with whose permission," it further said.

column2: Amazon overtakes Boeing as Washington state's largest private employer
column3: Amazon has become Washington state's largest private employer, overtaking airplane manufacturer Boeing, reported Seattle Times. Amazon added 16,500 Washington-based jobs, bringing its total to 80,000 in the state. In comparison, Boeing ended 2020 with 58,800 employees, an 18% reduction since the start of 2020. Boeing has reportedly also been the state's largest employer post-World War II.

column2: Tesla to raise $5 billion as market cap crosses $600 billion
column3: Elon Musk-led Tesla on Tuesday announced that it will be raising $5 billion, marking its second capital raise in the last three months. The additional shares will be sold "from time to time" and "at-the-market" prices. Its shares are up nearly 670% this year with its market capitalisation crossing $600 billion. Tesla will join S&P 500 index later this month.

column2: Hrithik is the same boy who wraps his omelette in newspaper & goes for shoot: Rakesh
column3: Filmmaker Rakesh Roshan, while speaking about his actor-son Hrithik Roshan on the occasion of the latter's 47th birthday, said, "He's still the same hard-working boy who wraps his omelette in a newspaper and rushes to his shoot in the morning." "That kind of dedication is very rare. Any director including me is lucky to have him on board," Rakesh added.

column2: Biden urged by 33 advocacy groups to reject 'Big Tech' influence
column3: US President-elect Joe Biden has been urged by 33 antitrust, consumer advocacy and labour groups to reject the influence of 'Big Tech' companies on his administration. They've asked the administration to exclude executives and consultants working for or with companies such as Facebook, Amazon, Google, Microsoft and Apple, arguing that their business practices hurt consumers and the US economy.

column2: I'm going to be shooting back-to-back this year: Manoj Bajpayee
column3: During a recent interview, actor Manoj Bajpayee mentioned that 2021 is going to be a busy year for him and added, "I'm going to be shooting back-to-back this year." He further explained, "It's because of the piled up...work...due to nine months of no work. I've told my wife and daughter about my excessive workload...I hope they'll understand."

column2: Salman exempted again from appearance in blackbuck poaching case
column3: The district and sessions court on Saturday exempted actor Salman Khan from making an appearance in connection with the petition challenging trial court's sentence of five-year of imprisonment in the 1998 blackbucks poaching case in Jodhpur. Khan has now been asked to appear on February 6. The actor's counsel sought exemption considering the "pandemic situation".

column2: Tesla to raise $5 billion as market cap crosses $600 billion
column3: Elon Musk-led Tesla on Tuesday announced that it will be raising $5 billion, marking its second capital raise in the last three months. The additional shares will be sold "from time to time" and "at-the-market" prices. Its shares are up nearly 670% this year with its market capitalisation crossing $600 billion. Tesla will join S&P 500 index later this month.

column2: 9 out of 10 in poor nations to miss out on COVID-19 vaccine in 2021: Campaigners
column3: Nearly 70 low-income countries won't be able to vaccinate nine out of 10 people against COVID-19 next year unless the governments take urgent action, the People's Vaccine Alliance warned. Rich nations have bought enough doses to vaccinate their entire populations three times over, the group said. The alliance is a group of campaigning organisations, including Amnesty International and Oxfam.

column2: Anil apologises as IAF objects to wearing uniform inaccurately, abusing in 'AK vs AK'
column3: Actor Anil Kapoor apologised to the Indian Air Force (IAF) after the IAF objected to his upcoming film AK vs AK's trailer and said the IAF uniform was inaccurately donned and the language used by him was inappropriate. "I would like to sincerely offer my humble apologies for unintentionally hurting anyone's sentiments...I truly apologise," the actor said in a video.

column2: Elon Musk's tweet leads to 4.4% rise in Japanese game maker's shares
column3: Shares of a Japanese game maker Bandai Namco rose after the world's richest person Elon Musk tweeted a meme featuring a character from the game maker's Idolmaster franchise. Namco's shares surged as high as 4.4% in Tokyo on Wednesday. Idolmaster is a long-running series that initially started as an arcade game and grew to include mobile games and animated series.

column2: Tum karo toh sarcasm, aur koi kare toh racism: Sehwag condemns racial abuse at SCG
column3: Former Team India opener Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to condemn Australian fans racially abusing Team India cricketers at the Sydney Cricket Ground. "Tum karo toh sarcasm, aur koi kare toh racism. Very unfortunate with what some of the Australian crowd has been doing at the SCG and spoiling the vibes of a good Test series," he wrote.

column2: India has practically achieved its pre-2020 climate action targets: Javadekar
column3: Union Minister Prakash Javadekar said on Friday that India has practically achieved its pre-2020 climate action targets. "For the big countries, this is an answer from India, that though not responsible for climate change, we are taking responsible actions to mitigate the challenge," he said. "They must also commit to advance commitments of the Kyoto Protocol," Javadekar added.

column2: How many batsmen have got out on 199 in Test cricket?
column3: South Africa batsman Faf du Plessis on Monday became the 11th batsman to get out on 199 in Test cricket history. Other batsmen who got out on 199 are Mudassar Nazar (1984), Mohammed Azharuddin (1986), Matthew Elliott (1997), Sanath Jayasuriya (1997), Steve Waugh (1999), Younis Khan (2006), Ian Bell (2008), Steve Smith (2015), KL Rahul (2016) and Dean Elgar (2017).

column2: Yuvraj's father dropped from film over 'Hindu women were sold for 2 cents' remark
column3: Former cricketer Yuvraj Singh's father Yograj Singh has been dropped from Vivek Agnihotri's film 'The Kashmir Files' after Yograj commented that Hindu women were "sold for two cents" during a speech at a farmers' protest. "It's...not about Hindu...or Muslim women...He spoke so badly about women," said Agnihotri. "I'm not a...commercial filmmaker. I make films with a purpose," Agnihotri added.

column2: Party nahi chalegi till 6 in the morning: Police on catching celebs at pub at 3 am
column3: After celebrities like Suresh Raina and Guru Randhawa were caught at a nightclub in Mumbai's Andheri at 3 am following a raid, the Mumbai Police tweeted, "Party (Nahin) Chalegi Till Six In The Morning!" It added, "Action has been initiated against 34 people, out of which 19 were from Delhi and Punjab, including some celebrities #NewNormal."

column2: Jeff Bezos shares video of rocket engine, says 'this will take 1st woman to moon'
column3: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, who also founded aerospace company Blue Origin, has shared a video of testing of BE-7 rocket engine. "This is the engine that will take the first woman to the surface of the Moon," he wrote on Instagram. The video shared by him shows colourful flames coming out of the engine during the test.

column2: Kia Motors launches sci-fi campaign, takes SUV Sonet to the 'future'
column3: With an aim to make a disruptive campaign for the Kia Sonet, Kia Motors has launched a sci-fi campaign where it shows the Earth's forces, The Warrior & Sonet-The beast, in a battle against Nibiru's alien forces. Kia Sonet comes with advanced powertrain, BOSE Premium 7-speaker system with Sound Mood lights. Powered by UVO, Sonet also offers 57 connected features.

column2: Take strict action against Amazon for causing misery to traders: CAIT to ED
column3: Traders' body CAIT has written to the ED seeking "strict action" against Amazon, claiming that it has caused "misery" to small traders by resorting to predatory pricing. It has provided ED with all the "necessary details" to prove that Amazon has "brazenly" violated India's laws. It has also raised questions on how Amazon has been "carrying on multi-brand retail trading".

column2: Tesla stock that gained 740% in 2020 gets divided price targets for 2021
column3: JPMorgan analysts have rated Tesla stock "underweight" and given it a price target of $90 for 2021, an 87% drop from current levels. On the other hand, Goldman Sachs has a "neutral" rating for Tesla, with a 12-month price target of $780. Tesla opened at $84.90 on January 2, 2020, and gained 740% over the year to close above $700-mark.

column2: Bezos congratulates Elon Musk's SpaceX on Starship rocket launch
column3: Amazon Founder and world's richest person Jeff Bezos took to Instagram to congratulate Elon Musk-led SpaceX for the launch of their Starship rocket on Thursday. "Anybody who knows how hard this stuff is is impressed by today's...test," Bezos, who's also the Founder of space exploration company Blue Origin, wrote. The Starship rocket exploded on landing after a seven-minute flight.

column2: Australia end Day 1 of Brisbane Test at 274/5 as Labuschagne slams hundred
column3: Australia ended the first day of the Brisbane Test against India at 274/5. Marnus Labuschagne smashed 108 runs off 204 balls, which is his fifth Test hundred. Team India debutants T Natarajan and Washington Sundar picked up three wickets between themselves. Meanwhile, fast bowler Navdeep Saini complained of pain in his groin and is currently being monitored.

column2: NASA takes pic of 'Wolf Moon'; shares the story behind the name
column3: NASA shared a picture of 'Wolf Moon', the 13th and final full Moon of 2020 that will be visible for about three days. NASA said the Algonquin tribes of what is now the northern and eastern US named it 'Wolf Moon' as packs of wolves howled hungrily outside villages in winter. Another name for it is 'Ice Moon', NASA said.

column2: Apple adds more Tesla ex-execs to its self-driving car team: Report
column3: A "small team" at Apple working on its self-driving car has seen the addition of more former Tesla executives, Bloomberg reported. The report said Apple recently hired Jonathan Sive, a vehicle engineer from Tesla and Waymo, as a senior manager on the car project. It also hired former Tesla engineering VP Steve MacManus, who is now working for the project.

column2: US sees biggest drop in greenhouse gases emissions post WWll era: Report
column3: The US' greenhouse gas emissions fell 10.3% in 2020, the largest drop in emissions in post-World War II era, due to COVID-19, the Rhodium Group reported. By comparison, the 2009 economic recession caused emissions to drop by 6.3%. Under the 2009 Copenhagen Accord, the US pledged that by 2020, it will have cut its emissions by 17% from 2005 levels.

column2: General Motors to not acquire 11% stake in Nikola
column3: General Motors (GM) and Nikola on Monday announced a reworked deal that replaced their previous agreement under which GM would acquire 11% equity stake in the startup and produce the proposed electric pickup Badger. The companies have instead signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding which is subject to negotiation. Nikola was previously accused of fraud by a short seller.

column2: FIR filed against 'Mirzapur' creators for allegedly defaming Mirzapur
column3: An FIR has been registered against producers of the web series 'Mirzapur' at the Kotwali Dehat Police Station of Mirzapur district in UP for allegedly defaming the district. The FIR was registered on the complaint of a local resident, who alleged that the show promotes social enmity, presents the district in a bad light and "has hurt his religious sentiments".

column2: I don't think it was the right approach: Ponting on Pujara's 50 off 176 balls
column3: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that India batsman Cheteshwar Pujara's 50-run knock off 176 balls put "too much" pressure on his batting partners. "I don't think it was the right approach, I think he needed to be a bit more proactive with his scoring rate," Ponting added. Pujara had scored 16 runs from the first 100 balls.

column2: Nurse in Indonesia strips off PPE to have sex with Covid patient in toilet, suspended
column3: A nurse at the Wisma Atlet Emergency Hospital in Indonesia's Jakarta has been suspended after admitting to stripping off his PPE to have sex with a COVID-19 positive patient in the hospital toilet. The patient uploaded a screenshot of WhatsApp messages between them after which an investigation took place. The pair are currently both in independent isolation.

column2: May God bless you with a long life: PM to Sonia on her birthday
column3: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday wished Congress chief Sonia Gandhi on the occasion of her 74th birthday, tweeting, "May God bless her with a long and healthy life." Union Minister Nitin Gadkari also tweeted, "Birthday greetings to the President of the Indian National Congress party Smt Sonia Gandhi Ji. May you be blessed with good health and long life."

column2: I had to work harder: Pankaj on playing protagonist in 'Kaagaz'
column3: Talking about playing the lead role in 'Kaagaz', actor Pankaj Tripathi said, "The responsibility didn't increase as such, but I did know that all eyes will be on my performance. So I had to work harder." He added, "An artiste does become more aware in such a scenario." Pankaj plays a character named Lal Bihari Mritak in the film.

column2: Working with Sony to get Cyberpunk 2077 back: CD Projekt
column3: Polish video game maker CD Projekt's CEO Adam Kicinski on Wednesday said the company is working with Sony to bring back its Cyberpunk 2077 to PlayStation Store. He added that a date of return hasn't been fixed. Sony removed Cyberpunk 2077 from its PlayStation Store last month after several users complained about glitches, while Xbox maker Microsoft has offered refunds.

column2: A designer told my team they don't give clothes to TV actors: Shivangi Joshi
column3: TV actress Shivangi Joshi, who stars in show 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai', has said she feels hurt when people look down upon the medium. Sharing her experience with a fashion designer, she said, "I'd once wanted to wear a particular designer's clothes, but my team was told that they don't give their clothes to TV actors...It does feel bad."

column2: Today would've been his 50 yrs in Bollywood: Neetu remembers Rishi
column3: Neetu Kapoor on Friday remembered her late husband Rishi Kapoor as his film 'Mera Naam Joker' completed 50 years of release. Sharing a collage of Rishi on Instagram, she wrote, "'Mera Naam Joker' released on 18th December 1970...today would've been his 50 years in...Indian film industry." Commenting on Neetu's post, Anil Kapoor wrote, "Miss his presence on and off screen."

column2: Didn't ignore protocol, got admitted 30 min after testing COVID +ve: Vij
column3: A day after testing positive for COVID-19, Haryana Health Minister Anil Vij on Sunday tweeted that he did not ignore any COVID-19 protocol and took admission at a hospital after half an hour of testing positive. He took to Twitter to refute a newspaper report that stated he did not follow protocols and kept meeting people despite being coronavirus positive.

column2: It was shot in Oct 2019: Bingo after Sushant's fans allege ad mocks him
column3: After Ranveer Singh's Bingo ad mentioning 'photons' was criticised by Sushant Singh Rajput's fans for allegedly mocking the late actor, Bingo issued a clarification. "The...advertisement was shot more than a year ago in October 2019. It's being aired this year because of delay in the launch of [products] due to...COVID-19," the statement read. #BoycottBingo trended on Twitter after the backlash.

column2: Over ₹101 cr lottery prize goes unclaimed in Germany
column3: A lottery winner has failed to collect €11.3 million (over ₹101 crore) in prize money by its deadline on December 31, 2020. The winning ticket was announced on April 1, 2017. "Even after a long search, we still sincerely wish we could have been able to pay out the lucky fellow," Georg Wacker, managing director of state-owned Lotto Baden-Württemberg, said.

column2: Walking is the best way for me to metabolise fat: Rebel Wilson
column3: During an Instagram live session, Hollywood actress Rebel Wilson revealed that walking was the exercise that helped her lose weight. "I do have access to really amazing personal trainers. But...the majority of exercise I've done this year has just been me going out for a walk. Walking is the best way for me...to metabolise fat," she said.

column2: Tesla's market value crosses $500 bn as shares surge six-fold this year
column3: Tesla Inc crossed $500 billion in market value on Tuesday as its share price surged six-fold this year. Tesla's shares rose as much as 3.9% to a record high of $542.35 in early trading. CEO Elon Musk has added $100.3 billion to his net worth so far this year, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index.

column2: Odisha Minister Pratap Jena among 13 booked for murder of BJP leader, aide
column3: The Odisha police has registered a case against 13 people, including state Law Minister Pratap Jena, after 75-year-old BJP leader Kulamani Baral and his associate were hacked to death in Cuttack district. The case was registered on the basis of a complaint by Baral's son, who alleged that his father was killed at the behest of Jena.

column2: For 3.5 yrs, I was struggling to get work: Ranveer on his B'wood career
column3: Ranveer Singh, whose debut film 'Band Baaja Baaraat' on Thursday marked 10 years of its release, said that for almost three and a half years, he was struggling to get work. "I was 21 when I started trying my luck...at 24, it worked out for me in a spectacular fashion," he added. "I almost debuted...in 'Patiala House'," Ranveer further said.

column2: 1st time I didn't know how crew looked like: Arjun on shooting amid COVID-19
column3: Actor Arjun Rampal has said it was extremely challenging to shoot for 'Nail Polish' amid the coronavirus pandemic. He added that all the necessary precautions were taken on the sets. "This was...first time when I didn't know how...crew looked like because...of...mask. One thing...I'll never forget was their eyes which were filled with gratitude to be back at work," said Arjun.

column2: Far-right activists got bitcoins worth $500k before US Capitol violence: Report
column3: Bitcoin payments worth more than $500,000 were made to 22 different virtual wallets, most of them belonging to far-right activists and internet personalities in the US, before the US Capitol violence, cryptocurrency compliance startup Chainalysis said on Friday. The startup added that it has "strong evidence"  that the donor was a "now-deceased computer programmer based in France".

column2: Indian-American Raja Chari among 18 astronauts selected for next moon missions
column3: Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari is among the 18 astronauts selected to begin training for upcoming Artemis missions to the moon, NASA announced on Wednesday. The first woman and the next man on the moon will come from this group of 18 astronauts. "Proud to be part of the team working to take humans to the moon to stay," Chari tweeted.

column2: 36 British MPs write to UK govt in support of farmers' protest in India
column3: Thirty-six UK Members of Parliament have written to the country's Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab seeking an intervention of the government on the farmers' issue in India. Citing that the new farm laws are being described as "death warrant", the MPs said, "This is an issue of particular concern to Sikhs in the UK and those linked to Punjab."

column2: 2020 ties with 2016 as warmest year on record: EU
column3: According to data published by the EU climate monitoring service, 2020 tied with 2016 for the warmest year worldwide. The year was also the warmest year in Europe since records began. It topped the previous temperature record of 2019 in Europe by 0.4°C. The data showed 2020 was 1.25°C warmer than during the pre-industrial period from 1850-1900.

column2: India's 1st mRNA vaccine candidate gets DCGI nod for human trials
column3: India's first indigenous mRNA vaccine candidate has received approval to initiate Phase 1 and 2 human clinical trials from Drugs Controller General of India (DCGI). Pune-based Gennova Biopharmaceuticals developed the COVID-19 vaccine candidate, HGCO19, in collaboration with US-based HDT Bio. The vaccine demonstrated "safety and immunogenicity" in rodent and non-human primate models, Gennova said.

column2: Lyon builds pressure, he'll be a massive threat for India: Ponting
column3: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has said that spinner Nathan Lyon, who gave 68 runs in his 21 overs during India's first innings at Adelaide, will be a "massive threat" for the visitors. "Lyon looked like he troubled Pujara...He builds pressure, he bowls very few bad balls," Ponting added. Lyon has picked 390 wickets in 96 Tests.

column2: Russia likely behind government agency hack: US intel agencies
column3: US intelligence and law enforcement agencies said the recent hack of government departments and corporations was "likely Russian in origin". They added that the purpose of the hacks was "intelligence gathering" rather than an attempt to disrupt or damage government operations. Earlier, President Donald Trump had blamed China for the data breach which reportedly infiltrated thousands of US firms.

column2: Veteran Congress leader Motilal Vora passes away a day after his 93rd birthday
column3: Veteran Congress leader and former Madhya Pradesh CM Motilal Vora passed away on Monday, a day after celebrating his 93rd birthday. He was admitted to Fortis Escorts Hospital in Delhi due to urine infection, according to reports. The leader was infected with coronavirus but had recovered and got discharged in October.

column2: NASA shares pic of Himalayan mountains, Delhi's city lights captured from space
column3: NASA took to Instagram to share a picture of snow-covered Himalayan mountains and Delhi's city lights captured from space. "The bright city lights of New Delhi, India, and Lahore, Pakistan, are...visible below the faint, orange airglow of atmospheric particles reacting to solar radiation," NASA wrote. Reacting to the picture, a user wrote, "This is so beautiful."

column2: In 2021, knee replacement for the aged will be my priority: Sonu
column3: During a recent interview, actor Sonu Sood said that in 2021, he wants to make knee-transplant surgery for the aged his priority. Stating that knee-replacement is one of the neglected areas of medical attention, the actor said, "Your parents taught you to walk...now it's your turn to make sure they can walk...I want to optimize knee surgery for the aged."

column2: France reports first case of coronavirus variant found in UK
column3: France reported its first case of the new coronavirus variant that emerged in the UK after a man who flew in from London tested positive. The man, who arrived on December 19, is currently self-isolating at home, French Health Ministry said. UK identified the new COVID-19 variant that it said is 70% more transmissible last week.

column2: CPI(M) leader's son taken into custody by ED in B'luru drug case
column3: Bineesh Kodiyeri, son of CPI(M) leader Kodiyeri Balakrishnan, was on Thursday taken into custody by the ED in Bengaluru for his links to an accused in the drug peddling cases. Bineesh has been questioned two times by the ED in relation to this case. His name surfaced when Anoop Mohammed, a native of Kochi, was held by NCB and questioned.

column2: People think celebs fake mental health issues for publicity: Aakanksha Singh
column3: Speaking about mental health, actress Aakanksha Singh said, "People in our industry often get targeted because people usually think that we're faking it for publicity." "We should rather be sensitive about it and shouldn't...jump to the conclusion that it's a publicity stunt," she added. "We should listen to people because it's a difficult thing to live with," Aakanksha further said.

column2: I'm in need of money: Vikas Gupta on saying yes to Bigg Boss 14
column3: Former Bigg Boss contestant Vikas Gupta, while talking about participating in the season 14, said, "Last two years have been difficult. I need money." Talking about his role in the show, Vikas said he's not participating as a challenger. "There is a twist, that's the reason why I am going...But, yes, I will be competing in the finale," he added.

column2: NCP dismisses reports of Sharad Pawar replacing Sonia as UPA chief
column3: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Thursday dismissed reports of party chief Sharad Pawar replacing Congress President Sonia Gandhi as the chairperson of the United Progressive Alliance (UPA). "The reports appearing in the media seem to have been planted with vested interest to divert the attention from the ongoing farmers' agitation," NCP chief spokesperson Mahesh Tapase said.

column2: Modi govt's apathy, arrogance has claimed lives of 60 farmers: Rahul
column3: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday said that Modi government's apathy and arrogance have claimed lives of over 60 farmers. "Instead of wiping their tears, GOI is busy attacking them with tear gas," Rahul said. He added, "Such brutality, just to promote crony capitalists' business interests. Repeal the anti-farm laws."

column2: 30,000 tremors hit Antarctica in 3 months: Scientists
column3: More than 30,000 tremors have rocked Antarctica since the end of August, scientists at University of Chile said. The small earthquakes were detected in Bransfield Strait, an ocean channel between South Shetland Islands and Antarctic Peninsula. Several tectonic plates and microplates meet near the strait, leading to frequent rumbling, but the past three months have been unusual, scientists said.

column2: Alibaba to shut down its 12-year-old music streaming app
column3: Jack Ma-founded Chinese tech conglomerate Alibaba on Tuesday announced that it is shutting its 12-year-old music streaming app Xiami. "It’s hard to say goodbye after being with you for 12 years," the app, which was acquired by Alibaba in 2013, said. This comes as Jack Ma is reportedly "laying low" amid the Chinese government's investigations into his business empire.

column2: Assam's BTC poll results show people's faith in PM's leadership: Nadda
column3: BJP President JP Nadda said that Assam's Bodoland Territorial Council (BTC) poll results show people's faith in leadership and policies of PM Narendra Modi. He also congratulated NDA partner UPPL, Assam CM Sarbananda Sonowal and other state BJP leaders for "securing clear majority". While BJP has won nine seats, UPPL has won 12 seats in the polls.

column2: Trump presents 'Legion of Merit' to PM Modi for elevating India-US ties
column3: US President Donald Trump has presented the 'Legion of Merit' to Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his "leadership in elevating the US-India strategic partnership". India's Ambassador to US, Taranjit Singh Sandhu, accepted the medal on behalf of PM Modi from the US National Security Advisor Robert O'Brien at the White House. Trump also presented 'Legion of Merit' to Australian PM.

column2: Will hopefully get married next yr, it'll be a small affair in Himachal: Vikrant
column3: Actor Vikrant Massey, while talking about his wedding with Sheetal Thakur, said, "Unfortunately, COVID-19 has really reshuffled our plans. Hopefully, next year for sure." "When is something we will have to work around it," he added. "It will be a small affair in Himachal, mine and Sheetal's native place," Vikrant further said.

column2: Japan must compensate ex-Nissan Chairman for arbitrary arrest: UN panel
column3: The UN Working Group on Arbitrary Detention on Monday ruled that Former Nissan Chairman Carlos Ghosn's multiple arrests and detentions in Japan were "arbitrary" and urged Japanese government to pay compensation. Japan said the panel doesn't have an "accurate understanding of the country's criminal justice system". Ghosn, who was arrested in 2018 in Japan, fled to Lebanon last year.

column2: India need 309 runs on last day to win Sydney Test and take 2-1 series lead
column3: India ended the fourth day of the Sydney Test against Australia at 98/2 on Sunday, needing another 309 runs to win. Earlier in the day, Marnus Labuschagne's 73, Steve Smith's 81 and Cameron Green's 84 helped Australia declare their second innings at 312/6. India openers Rohit Sharma and Shubman Gill shared a 71-run opening stand in the second innings.

column2: At least 7 killed in suicide bombing at ice cream parlour in Somalia
column3: At least seven people were killed and 10 others were injured after a suicide bomber blew himself up in an ice cream parlour in Somalia's capital Mogadishu on Friday, police said. Al-Qaeda-linked al-Shabaab extremist group claimed responsibility for the attack. This comes hours after US Acting Defense Secretary Christopher Miller visited Mogadishu to meet US military personnel and envoy.

column2: China's Mars probe travels 400M km in 163 days, to enter Mars' orbit in Feb
column3: China's first Mars exploration mission Tianwen-1 travelled more than 400 million kilometres by January 3 and is expected to enter Mars' orbit next month, China's space agency said. It was about 130 million kilometres from Earth and about 8.3 million kilometres from Mars. After entering Mars' orbit, it will spend two-three months surveying potential landing sites.

column2: Saddened by this mob violence: Mark Zuckerberg on US Capitol violence
column3: Condemning the violence that occurred at the US Capitol, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg said that it was "a dark moment" in US history. "I'm personally saddened by this mob violence - which is exactly what this is," Zuckerberg wrote in a memo to his staff. He further said that peaceful transition of power is critical to the functioning of democracy.

column2: Tesla to join S&P 500 as largest-ever new member
column3: Elon Musk's Tesla will join the S&P 500 index as one of the largest-ever new members, prior to the opening of trading on December 21, potentially in two tranches. "It will generate one of the largest funding trades history," S&P Dow Jones Indices said. Tesla's stock market value of over $400 billion is larger than 95% of the index's companies.

column2: All rules are applicable to everyone else other than Kohli: Sehwag on team changes
column3: Criticising "frequent" changes made in Team India by captain Virat Kohli, former India opener Virender Sehwag said, "All the rules are applicable to everyone else other than Kohli, no rule is applicable to him." He added, "Neither his batting order is changed nor is he left out or given break when he is out of form. So, that is wrong.”

column2: Passenger vehicle retail sales grow by 24% in December: FADA
column3: Passenger vehicle (PV) retail sales in December rose by 24% year-on-year to 2,71,249 units, the Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) said. Automobile registrations across the country grew by 11% in December from the year-ago period, showing positive growth for the first time in 2020-21, FADA added. Commercial vehicle sales fell 13.5% year-on-year to 51,454 units in December 2020.

column2: Will fight till Armenian forces leave disputed region: Azerbaijan
column3: Azerbaijan President Ilham Aliyev said that he wanted to end the conflict in the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh and seven surrounding regions through negotiations as long as it ends with ethnic Armenian forces withdrawing from there. Otherwise, our troops will "go to the end", he added. "We will continue by any means to restore our territorial integrity," he added.

column2: Intact Ice Age-era woolly rhino discovered in Siberia
column3: Paleontologists have found one of the best-preserved specimens of an Ice Age-era woolly rhino to date in Siberia. The rhino is believed to have lived in the late Pleistocene era, anywhere between 20,000 and 50,000 years ago. It was discovered with all its limbs, some of its organs including part of the intestines, its tusk and a lump of fat.

column2: UAE target of cyberattacks after forming ties with Israel: Official
column3: The UAE was the target of cyberattacks after establishing formal ties with Israel, the country's cybersecurity head Mohamed Hamad Al-Kuwaiti said. He added that the financial sector was targeted but did not elaborate. He didn't specify if the attacks were successful or provide details on who the perpetrators were.

column2: UP govt to take back 173 acres of land of Azam Khan's Jauhar Trust
column3: Rampur district administration has passed an order to take back 173 acres of land of Jauhar Trust, headed by SP leader Azam Khan and his family, and register it in Uttar Pradesh government's name. The court found that the trust was not following conditions set by the UP government during sale of the land in 2005, ADGC (Revenue) said.

column2: 50-year-old problem of biology solved by Artificial Intelligence
column3: DeepMind's AI system 'AlphaFold' has been recognised as a solution to "protein folding", a grand challenge in biology for over 50 years. DeepMind showed it can predict how proteins fold into 3D shapes, a complex process that is fundamental to understanding the biological machinery of life. AlphaFold can predict the shape of proteins within the width of an atom.

column2: 95% of vaccines given around world are in 10 countries: WHO
column3: Ten countries account for 95% of the 2.35 crore coronavirus vaccine doses administered across the world, the head of WHO's European office, Dr Hans Kluge, said. In response, the WHO has called for more equitable distribution. In terms of total doses, the top countries are the US, China, the UK, Israel, the UAE, Italy, Russia, Germany, Spain and Canada.

column2: South Korea's population falls for first time in its history
column3: South Korea's population has fallen for the first time in the country's history as births dropped to a historic low amid the pandemic. The latest census figures show population stood at 51,829,023 at the end of December, down by 20,838 from the previous year. South Korea is also experiencing a rise in the number of people aged 60 and over.

column2: Google is allowing socially-distanced outdoor meetings on campus
column3: Google has started allowing employees to hold socially-distanced outdoor meetings on its campuses. Known as "onsite off-sites", it's an attempt to bring aboard new hires and collaborate on important projects offline, a company spokesperson told CNBC. Earlier, CEO Sundar Pichai, in an interview with TIME, said that Google's future wouldn't be 100% remote but it'd involve hybrid models of work.

column2: Russia to join naval drills with NATO members for 1st time in 10 yrs
column3: Russia on Thursday said that its navy will take part in AMAN-2021 anti-piracy drills off the coast of Pakistan in February 2021 along with the navies of 30 other countries, including NATO members. It will be the first time in 10 years that Russian vessels will take part in exercises alongside NATO ships, the TASS news agency reported.

column2: Singer Guru Randhawa's team issues statement over Mumbai pub COVID-19 rule breach
column3: Guru Randhawa's team has issued a statement after the singer was booked for violating COVID-19 rules at a Mumbai pub. "Guru Randhawa...deeply regrets the unintentional incident...Unfortunately, he wasn't aware of local authorities' decision of night curfew," it read. "He promises to comply with government guidelines and protocols by taking all precautionary measures in the future," it added.

column2: India's fuel demand falls again in November after one-month pause
column3: India's fuel demand resumed its downward trajectory last month after rising for the first time in seven months in October, Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell data showed. While the overall consumption for petroleum products in November declined by nearly 4% against last year, the demand for petrol rose over 5%. Kerosene and diesel consumption slipped by 18% and 7% respectively.

column2: Thiel-backed Bridgetown considers merger with Tokopedia: Report
column3: Peter Thiel-backed blank-check acquisition firm Bridgetown Holdings is considering a potential merger with Indonesia's PT Tokopedia, Bloomberg reported. SoftBank-backed Tokopedia could be valued between $8-$10 billion in a deal. Deliberations are at a preliminary stage and Bridgetown could still look at other potential targets. Bridgetown's shares soared 25% in premarket trading after the report.

column2: SpaceX will try to 'catch' boosters returning from space: Elon Musk
column3: Elon Musk said that SpaceX will "try to catch" Super Heavy rocket boosters returning from outer space instead of making them land. This will be done with the help of a launch tower arm, he added. Currently, the return of Falcon 9 boosters involve touching down on a boat or a launchpad using "legs" that are built into the rocket.

column2: Own a car without buying it : Revv Subscriptions
